TextJPN: そして、翌日。
TextENG: And, the next day.

TextJPN: 午後の最後の時限は体育だった。俺たちは体操着に着替え、校庭に出る。
TextENG: The last class of the afternoon was PE. So, we changed into our gym clothes and went out to the school yard.

TextJPN: そこにはいち早く、クラスの下級生たちが顔を揃えて待っていた。
TextENG: Our underclassmen had all rushed out there and were waiting with their heads turned this way.

TextJPN: 「よぅ、待たせた…な？」
TextENG: ``Yo. Kept you waiting... huh?``

TextJPN: 気安くいつものように声をかけ…ようとして、思わず上げた手を途中で止める。
TextENG: I tried to casually call out to them and unconsciously held up a hand... but I stopped halfway.

TextJPN: 彼らは俺たちの顔を見ると、いつもの無邪気な笑顔は何処へやら、緊張と気合のこもった表情で、
TextENG: They were all looking at us with tense, spirited looks rather than their usual smiles.

TextJPN: 「「よろしくお願いしま――すっ！！」」
TextENG: ````Looking forward to iiit!!````

TextJPN: と大声を揃えて俺たちに向き直った。
TextENG: They turned to us and shouted with booming voices.

TextJPN: その勢いに一瞬、気圧されそうになったが、
TextENG: For a moment, I felt overwhelmed by the pressure.

TextJPN: 「お――おうっ！！」
TextENG: ``R... right!!``

TextJPN: すぐさま負けずに俺も、張り上げた声を返す。
TextENG: I shouted back at them without missing a beat.

TextJPN: 下級生たち全員から伝わる、ものすごい気迫。それだけ俺たちの仲間になりたいという心のあらわれに思えてとても、嬉しくなった。
TextENG: The younger students successfully conveyed their tremendous spirit. And I was thrilled that they were so passionate about becoming our comrades.

TextJPN: 「おー？　みんな気合入ってるねぇ！@k@vS14/03/210300085.　こりゃ楽しみだよ」
TextENG: ``Ohh? Looks like everyone's fired up!@k@vS14/03/210300085. Looking forward to it.``

TextJPN: 「あははは！@k@vS14/02/210200048.　なんだかとっても手強そう！@k@vS14/02/210200049.　こっちもいつも以上に頑張らないとね！」
TextENG: ``Ahahaha!@k@vS14/02/210200048. They look really tough!@k@vS14/02/210200049. I'll have to work even harder than usual!``

TextJPN: 続いて校庭に出てきたレナと魅音も、彼らの熱い想いを感じ取ってか、にこやかな表情。
TextENG: Then, Rena and Mion came out to the schoolyard with huge smiles on their faces after witnessing the passion of our underclassmen.

TextJPN: ――だが、目だけは笑っていない。まるで獲物を見定めようとする猛禽類のように、彼らの威嚇を真正面から受け止めている。
TextENG: ...But there was no levity in their eyes. They were like raptors stalking their prey as they sized up the adversaries before them.

TextJPN: そう、勝負はすでに始まっているのだ！
TextENG: Indeed, the game has already begun!

TextJPN: 「をーっほっほっほっ！@k@vS14/04/210400102.　強い敵ほど倒し甲斐があるというものでございますわ！！」
TextENG: ``Oh ho ho ho!@k@vS14/04/210400102. The stronger the opponent, the greater the value in their defeat!!``

TextJPN: 「北条…その余裕、いつまで続くかな？」
TextENG: ``Houjou... how much longer will you be saying that?``

TextJPN: 「あらぁ？@k@vS14/04/210400104.　詩音さんの腰巾着の分際で、いつからそんな大口を？」
TextENG: ``What now?@k@vS14/04/210400104. Since when did Shion-san's trained lackeys have such big mouths?``

TextJPN: 「はっはっは！@k@vS14/25/212500007.　あなた方の不敗伝説も、今日が限りとさせてもらいますよ！」
TextENG: ``Ha ha ha!@k@vS14/25/212500007. Your undefeated reign ends today!``

TextJPN: 富田くんも岡村くんも怯むことなく、挑発的な態度だ。沙都子の皮肉にも踊らされず、柔軟運動を念入りに行いながら腕を撫している。
TextENG: Tomita-kun and Okamura-kun wasted no time before provoking her. Rather than dancing to Satoko's sarcasm, they were flexing and patting their arms.

TextJPN: なかなかの顔立ちだ…これなら俺たちの仲間に加わっても、しっかり鍛えれば十分、今後の戦力になってくれるに違いない！
TextENG: An impressive display... If they join our group, they'll become an unstoppable force with the proper training!

TextJPN: 「圭一くん、まだ早いよ？@k@vS14/02/210200051.　誰を入部させるかは、今日のこの時間にかかってるんだから」
TextENG: ``Keiichi-kun, isn't it a little early for that?@k@vS14/02/210200051. Whether they'll be able to join or not will be determined today.``

TextJPN: レナはさりげなく、浮つきそうな俺の考えに釘を刺す。
TextENG: Rena casually warned me as if she could read my mind.

TextJPN: まぁ、確かにそうなんだけど。誰が入るかはともかく、新メンバーを今から決めるかと思うと、なんだかわくわくしてくるぜ！
TextENG: Well, I suppose that's true. But regardless of who makes the cut, I'm excited by the prospect of new members!

TextJPN: 「とはいえ、私たちのお眼鏡にかなわなかったら、入部者ゼロってのもありえるけどね」
TextENG: ``Although, if they don't live up to our strict expectations, it's possible there won't be any new members at all.``

TextJPN: 「そういうことですわ！@k@vS14/04/VT4Ba_satoko1012.　さて、私たち相手にどこまで楽しませてもらえるのか、とくと拝見させていただきますわぁ！」
TextENG: ``Precisely!@k@vS14/04/VT4Ba_satoko1012. Now, the time has come to see to what extent our adversaries will be able to entertain us!``

TextJPN: 入部試験とはいえ３人とも、容赦する気持ちはさらさらないらしい。
TextENG: Even though this was just an entrance exam, the three of them were absolutely unforgiving.

TextJPN: 気持ちはわかるが、いきなり俺たちと同等を要求するなんて酷だろ？…なんて思う俺は、甘いのだろうか。
TextENG: I understand how they feel, but isn't it unfair to suddenly demand they perform at the same level as the rest of us? ...Or maybe I'm getting soft?

TextJPN: そこへ、
TextENG: Just then,

TextJPN: 「強い想いがあれば、きっと頑張れるのです。@k@vS14/05/210500082.だからボクたちも、本気でぶつかってあげるのが礼儀だと思うのです」
TextENG: ``If they have strong convictions, I'm sure they'll do their best.@k@vS14/05/210500082. That's why it's only fair for us to fight back in earnest.``

TextJPN: 「――梨花ちゃん」
TextENG: ``...Rika-chan.``

TextJPN: 「高い山になればそれだけ、越えたときの嬉しさも増すのです。@k@vS14/05/210500084.だから圭一もふぁいと、おーなのですよ」
TextENG: ``The taller the mountain, the greater the joy of surmounting it.@k@vS14/05/210500084. So you have to fight on.``

TextJPN: 梨花ちゃんは俺のためらいを見抜いたように、そう言って励ます。その言葉を聞いて、少しだけ心が軽くなった。
TextENG: Rika-chan seemed to sense my hesitation and offered me encouragement. Hearing her say that did make the weight feel a little lighter.

TextJPN: …確かに、そうかもしれない。全力でぶつかってくる相手には、全力で答えてこそ意味がある。中途半端な優しさは、かえって彼らに対して失礼というものだ。
TextENG: ...Indeed, that's true. A competition is only meaningful if you and your opponent both clash at full power. In fact, to come at them with half-hearted softness would be terribly insulting.

TextJPN: 「そうだな、よしっ！@k@vS14/01/210100058.　俺も全力以上で頑張るぜ！！」
TextENG: ``Yeah, that's right!@k@vS14/01/210100058. Then I'll use my full strength and give it everything I've got!!``

TextJPN: 「ん？　どうした、梨花ちゃん？」
TextENG: ``Hmm? What's wrong, Rika-chan?``

TextJPN: 「……圭一。@k@vS14/05/210500087.今の言葉で、何か思い出したりしませんですか？」
TextENG: ``...Keiichi.@k@vS14/05/210500087. Does what you just said remind you of anything?``

TextJPN: 「今の言葉…？@k@vS14/01/210100061.　どういう意味だ、梨花ちゃん？」
TextENG: ``What I just said...?@k@vS14/01/210100061. What do you mean by that, Rika-chan?``

TextJPN: 「…いえ、なんでもないのです」
TextENG: ``...Oh, it's nothing.``

TextJPN: 一瞬、梨花ちゃんの顔が憂鬱そうに曇ったかのように見える。が、それを確かめようとする前にくるっと踵を返すと、梨花ちゃんはそのまま背を向け沙都子の方に歩いていった。
TextENG: Rika-chan's expression seemed to cloud over for a moment. But before I had a chance to ask any further, Rika-chan turned and began walking toward Satoko without looking back.
``Is something wrong?@k@vS14/02/210200053. Keiichi-kun.``

TextJPN: 「あ、いや…なんでもない」
TextENG: ``Ah, no... it's nothing.``

TextJPN: なんだろう…ちくりと、胸の奥で何かがざわめいているような気がするんだけど…。
TextENG: I don't know what it is... but it feels like something is stirring deep in my chest.

TextJPN: 「さぁて、それじゃまずは交戦規定だ！@k@vS14/03/210300088.　みんな、これを背中につけてくれる？」
TextENG: ``All right then. First, the rules of engagement!@k@vS14/03/210300088. Everyone, would you mind putting one of these on your back?``

TextJPN: 魅音はそう言うと、白いゼッケンを全員に配る。それは運動会のときに使うようなもので、白い長方形をした生地だ。
TextENG: Mion began passing out white slips to everyone as she said that. They were made of white rectangular fabric, like the sort of thing you'd see people wearing at an athletic meet.

TextJPN: 他にもあらかじめ用意していたのだろう、梨花ちゃんが安全ピンと黒マジックの入った箱を教室から持ってきていた。
TextENG: Rika-chan was carrying a box of safety pins and black magic markers that she had prepared in advance.

TextJPN: 「通常なら見つけた子の名前を読み上げるのがルールだけど、校庭なら見晴らしが良くて鬼には有利だからね」
TextENG: ``Normally, the rule is that you have to read aloud the name of any kid you catch, but this schoolyard has high visibility which gives the person who's ``it`` an advantage.``

TextJPN: 「そこで今回は、好きな番号をゼッケンに書いて、それを背中に貼り付ける。@k@vS14/03/210300091.その背番号を缶に足をつけた鬼に読み上げられたらアウトだよ！@k@vS14/03/210300092.　それから――」
TextENG: ``So this time, just write your favorite number on your tag and stick it to your back.@k@vS14/03/210300091. If the person who's ``it`` reads your number aloud while their foot is on the can, you're out!@k@vS14/03/210300092. Also...``

TextJPN: レナが手際よく石灰で地面に描いた、１ｍ半径の円をぽんぽんと足でつつきながら、魅音は説明を続ける。
TextENG: Mion continued her explanation as she prodded the circle with her foot, which Rena had efficiently drawn on the ground in chalk with a radius of one meter.

TextJPN: 「鬼が缶に触れている間は、タッチされてもアウト！@k@vS14/03/210300094.　ただし鬼は、白い円の中に入っていいのは５秒間だけだからね！」
TextENG: ``If the person who's ``it`` touches you while touching the can, you're also out!@k@vS14/03/210300094. However, the person who's ``it`` can only enter the white circle for five seconds!``

TextJPN: 「なるほど。@k@vS14/01/210100065.…あ、それなら適当に番号言ってもいいのか？」
TextENG: ``I see.@k@vS14/01/210100065. ...Oh, but then couldn't we just call out whatever numbers we wanted if that's how it works?``

TextJPN: 「えーっと、その場合は…」
TextENG: ``Umm, in that case...``

TextJPN: 「あ、梨花ちゃん。@k@vS14/03/210300097.悪いけど、審判お願いしていい？」
TextENG: ``Oh, Rika-chan.@k@vS14/03/210300097. Sorry, but could I ask you to be the referee?``

TextJPN: 「審判…ですか？」
TextENG: ``R-referee...?``

TextJPN: 安全ピンと黒マジックを下級生に配っていた梨花ちゃんは、きょとんと顔を上げて魅音を見た。
TextENG: Rika-chan was still in the middle of passing out safety pins and markers to the younger students when she suddenly looked up at Mion.

TextJPN: 「そっ！@k@vS14/03/210300099.　ちゃんと鬼が背番号の数字を読み上げたか、梨花ちゃんに判断してもらう。@k@vS14/03/210300100.梨花ちゃんの言うことには、みんな従うこと！@k@vS14/03/210300101.　これなら、誰も文句言ったりしないでしょ？」
TextENG: ``Right!@k@vS14/03/210300099. Rika-chan will determine whether or not the person who's ``it`` read the proper number.@k@vS14/03/210300100. Everyone, follow Rika-chan's orders!@k@vS14/03/210300101. As long as we do that, there shouldn't be any complaints. Right?``

TextJPN: 「了解なのです。@k@vS14/05/210500091.まだちょっと調子が良くなかったから、ちょうど良かったのです」
TextENG: ``Roger that.@k@vS14/05/210500091. That's a good choice, because I'm still not feeling completely well.``

TextJPN: …そういえば、その言葉を裏付けるように少し、顔色が良くないように思える。
TextENG: ...Now that she mentions it, her complexion does look a little pale.

TextJPN: 「大丈夫ですの？　梨花…」
TextENG: ``Are you all right, Rika...?``

TextJPN: 「見ているだけなら平気なのです。@k@vS14/05/210500093.沙都子はボクの分まで、ふぁいと、おー、なのですよ」
TextENG: ``If I'm just watching, I'll be fine.@k@vS14/05/210500093. Satoko, you'll just have to fight on in my place.``

TextJPN: 「をーっほっほっほっ！@k@vS14/04/210400109.　梨花の分まで頑張ったら、私の相手になれる人間など銀河系には存在しなくなってしまいますわ！」
TextENG: ``Oh ho ho ho!@k@vS14/04/210400109. Were I to fight hard enough to fill Rika's share, no human in the galaxy would be a match for me!``

TextJPN: そう言って沙都子は、元気よく高笑いしてみせる。それをあおるように、梨花ちゃんがぱちぱちと手を叩いた。
TextENG: Satoko let out a boisterous, energetic laugh as she said that. Rika-chan clapped her hands together when she saw that.

TextJPN: 「宇宙最強コンビなのです。@k@vS14/05/210500095.ボクたちがタッグを組めば天下無双、元気爆発なのですよ。にぱ～☆」
TextENG: ``The strongest combination in the universe.@k@vS14/05/210500095. If we tag-teamed, our power would be an unparalleled explosion of energy. Nipah~☆.``

TextJPN: 言葉の意味は良くわからんが…とにかくすごい自信だな。
TextENG: I don't quite understand the meaning of that... but regardless, that's some impressive self-confidence.

TextJPN: 「さぁて、それじゃ肝心の入部の条件を言うよ！@k@vS14/03/210300103.　部活メンバーが鬼になるから、入部希望者は私たちに捕まることなく缶を蹴飛ばすことができれば、勝ちだ！@k@vS14/03/210300104.　制限時間はこの体育の時間内！@k@vS14/03/210300105.　わかった？！」
TextENG: ``Now then, let's talk about entry requirements!@k@vS14/03/210300103. The club members are all ``it.`` So, any candidate who manages to kick the can without being caught will be declared a winner!@k@vS14/03/210300104. The time limit is until the end of PE!@k@vS14/03/210300105. Got it?!``
``Yeaaaah...!!``

TextJPN: なるほど…俺たちの守りを突破してこそ、入部の資格ありってことか。これなら彼らが勝ったあかつきには、遠慮なく仲間に加えることが出来そうだな！
TextENG: I see... so the qualification for entry in our club is to successfully break through our defenses? If that's the case, I'm glad to welcome any of the winners amongst our ranks!

TextJPN: 「ちなみに、妨害は抱きついたり捕まえたりはＯＫだけど、ぐーパンチ、キックはなし！@k@vS14/03/210300107.　いいね、レナ？」
TextENG: ``By the way, hugging and grabbing a person are considered valid forms of interference, but punching and kicking are strictly forbidden!@k@vS14/03/210300107. You got it, Rena?``

TextJPN: 「はぅ～、なんでレナだけ名指しなのかな？　かな？」
TextENG: ``Hauu~, why is Rena the only one being called out by name? By name?``

TextJPN: むー、とむくれるレナ。しかし、確かにレナが本気でパンチを使ったら、背番号読み上げる前に全員ＫＯされてゲーム終了だ…。
TextENG: Rena became sullen. But if she was able to use her punches freely, everyone would be KO'd and the game would end before we could even read any numbers out...

TextJPN: 「しかし、結構なハンデだな。@k@vS14/01/210100067.こりゃなかなかハードかも」
TextENG: ``But that's a pretty strong handicap.@k@vS14/01/210100067. That may make this pretty hard.``

TextJPN: 「くっくっく！@k@vS14/03/210300109.　圭ちゃん、この程度でしり込み？@k@vS14/03/210300110.　私たち部活メンバーにゃ、この程度のハンデは軽すぎるくらいだよ！」
TextENG: ``Heh heh heh!@k@vS14/03/210300109. Kei-chan, is that all it takes to make you flinch?@k@vS14/03/210300110. For our club members, that sort of handicap is hardly a challenge!``

TextJPN: 「馬鹿にするな！@k@vS14/01/210100069.　魅音こそあっさり抜かれて、勝ちを譲ったりするなよ？！」
TextENG: ``Don't be ridiculous!@k@vS14/01/210100069. Don't you go slipping up and handing them victory on a silver platter either, Mion!``

TextJPN: 「あっはっは、その意気その意気！@k@vS14/03/210300112.　私たちの実力と部活の厳しさを、みんなに骨の髄まで思い知らせてやろう！」
TextENG: ``Aahaha, that's the spirit!@k@vS14/03/210300112. Let everyone know the true strength of our club, right down to the marrow of our bones!``

TextJPN: 「「おおぅっ！！」」
TextENG: ````Yeaaaah!!````

TextJPN: そして、鬼役の部活メンバーを除いた下級生たちが、背番号のゼッケンを安全ピンで体操服につけ終えるのを見届けてから、魅音は高らかに宣言した。
TextENG: Then, after confirming that all the club members were prepared to be ``it,`` and confirming that all the younger students had properly affixed the numbers to their clothes with safety pins, Mion shouted a proclamation.

TextJPN: 「それじゃ、ゲーム開始！@k@vS14/03/210300114.　キックオフは富田くん、よろしく！」
TextENG: ``Alright, let the game begin!@k@vS14/03/210300114. Start us up with a kickoff, Tomita-kun!``

TextJPN: 「任せてください！」
TextENG: ``Leave it to me!``

TextJPN: 「蹴った缶をここに戻してから１００数えるまでに、各自散開するように！@k@vS14/03/210300116.　さぁ、戦闘開始――っっ！！！」
TextENG: ``Once the can has been returned here, we'll count to 100, so spread out!@k@vS14/03/210300116. Now, commence the battle!!!``

TextJPN: 魅音の号令を受けて、助走をつけた富田くんが白い円の中に置かれた空き缶を思い切り蹴り上げる。
TextENG: On Mion's command, Tomita-kun ran up and kicked the empty can sitting inside the white circle.

TextJPN: カ――ン！！　と小気味良い音を立てて缶は宙へと舞い、それと同時にわっと歓声を上げながら下級生たちが駆け出していった。
TextENG: Pow! The can let out a satisfying sound as it flew through the air. And at the same time, the younger classmates cheered as they rushed away from here.

TextJPN: 「あはははは、すごいキック力だね！」
TextENG: ``Ahahahaha, that's an amazingly powerful kick!``

TextJPN: そう言いながら、飛んでいった空き缶をすぐさま駆け寄り拾い上げたレナは、猛ダッシュで白い円の中に置く。そして片足を缶の上に乗せながら、『１、２、３、４、…』と早い読み上げで数えていった。
TextENG: As she said that, Rena immediately rushed over to where the can landed then returned it to the white circle in a flash. And with one foot on the can, she began counting: ``1, 2, 3, 4...``

TextJPN: 「あれ？@k@vS14/01/210100072.　そういえばその缶、昨日のカレー缶だよな？@k@vS14/01/210100073.　中身はどうした、捨てたのか？」
TextENG: ``Huh?@k@vS14/01/210100072. Come to think of it, isn't that the same can of curry from yesterday?@k@vS14/01/210100073. What happened to the curry? Did you throw it out?``

TextJPN: 「…そんな恐ろしいことできないって。@k@vS14/03/210300118.ちゃんと知恵先生が昼食で食べてくれたよ」
TextENG: ``...I'd never do something so wasteful.@k@vS14/03/210300118. I gave it to Chie-sensei and she had it for lunch.``

TextJPN: 「なるほど…」
そういえば昼休みを終わってからの知恵先生、いつもよりご機嫌だったよな。…でも確か、これ業務用の１０人前入りだったはずでは？
TextENG: Come to think of it, Chie-sensei seemed to be in a better mood than usual after lunch break. ...But wasn't that a commercial-size can large enough to feed 10 people?

TextJPN: 「カレーの鬼だね…まさに」
TextENG: ``She really is... the curry demon.``

TextJPN: いや、微妙に突っ込みどころが違う気がするのは俺だけか？　…いいけどな。
TextENG: Wait, am I the only one who feels that's not the part to be pointing out? ...Not that it matters, I guess.

TextJPN: そうこうするうちに、レナは１００を数え終わって、俺たちは戦闘モードへと移行する。
TextENG: Meanwhile, Rena finished counting to 100 and we all switched into battle mode.

TextJPN: 最終防衛ラインとしてレナを残し、俺と魅音、沙都子は散開して下級生たちが隠れているであろう、校舎裏へと向かっていった。
TextENG: Rena stayed behind as the last line of defense, while Mion, Satoko, and I spread out along the back of the school building where the students would be hiding.

TextJPN: 「さて、どこだ…？」
TextENG: ``Now, where could they be...?``

TextJPN: 俺は周囲を用心深く見渡す。
TextENG: I carefully surveyed my surroundings.

TextJPN: ただタッチするだけだった以前のゾンビ鬼と違い、背中の番号を確認しなければいけない。そのためにはその退路を読んで、背中が見える位置に追い込む必要があった。
TextENG: Unlike in zombie tag where I can get someone out just by touching them, in this game I have to check the numbers on their backs. In order to do that, I have to push them to retreat and then drive them to a position where their backs are visible.

TextJPN: もちろん、捕まえて強引に背中を見る方法もあるだろう。しかし二人以上を発見した時は、一人にてこずるとそれ以外のやつに逃げられて、缶を狙われる危険もある。
TextENG: Of course, I might also be able to catch them and force them to show their backs. But if I discover two people together, there's a possibility that one of them could struggle well enough to allow the other to escape and target the can.

TextJPN: この特別ルールの缶ケリ…なかなかに戦術性が高い！
TextENG: The rules in this special variant of kick the can... demand considerable battle tactics!

TextJPN: 物陰にふと顔を向けたその時、狭い隙間に紛れ込んだ下級生を二人、発見する。彼らは俺と目が合うなり、だっと駆け足で缶のあるところへと走り出した。
TextENG: When I suddenly noticed a shadow and turned toward it, I found two classmates hiding inside a narrow gap. Our eyes met, and then they rushed toward the can.

TextJPN: 最初から打ち合わせていたのか、それぞれ違う方向に走ってから缶へと殺到する…が、背中を向けた瞬間すでに二人の背番号はインプット済みだ！
TextENG: Perhaps their plan from the beginning was to run in different directions and then rush the can... but the moment they turned their backs, I could see their numbers!

TextJPN: 「うおおぉぉ――っっ！！！」
TextENG: ``Whooooa...!!!``

TextJPN: 一瞬で二人を抜き去ると、俺は缶を踏みつけるようにがしっ、と足を乗せる。そして、
TextENG: I rushed past the two of them in an instant and slammed my foot down on the can hard enough to crush it. And then,

TextJPN: 「――アウトなのです」
TextENG: ``...You're out.``

TextJPN: さっと梨花ちゃんの手があがって、追い越された二人はガックリと膝をついた。ほっとする間もなく、沙都子に追い立てられた３人が校舎裏から飛び出してきて、俺の足元の缶めがけて殺到する。
TextENG: As soon as Rika-chan raised her hand, the two I had been pursuing knelt down to the ground. Shortly afterwards, three more students were driven out of the back of the school building by Satoko, and they came rushing to the can at my feet.

TextJPN: 「３人、撃墜なのです」
TextENG: ``Three more eliminated.``

TextJPN: 俺は沙都子の読み上げた数字を復唱して、缶を踏みつける。それを見て梨花ちゃんは手を上げ、３人のアウトを宣告した。
TextENG: I recited the numbers Satoko communicated and stepped on the can. As soon as Rika-chan saw that, she raised her hand and declared the three of them out.

TextJPN: ――そう、これも今回の特殊ルールの戦法のひとつだった。
TextENG: ...I see. That's a valid tactic under these special rules.

TextJPN: 猟犬役の鬼が相手を追い立て、ハンター役の鬼が缶のそばで仕留める。
TextENG: The hound ``it`` pursues a foe, and the hunter ``it`` finishes them off from beside the can.

TextJPN: 複数の鬼がいるからこその作戦だが、猟犬役がしっかりと背番号を確認しながら追い込まなくては、ハンター役は缶を蹴りにくるヤツを仕留めることができない。
TextENG: The strategy works because multiple people are ``it.`` However, the hound must drive them out and confirm their numbers too, otherwise the hunter can't finish them off when they approach the can.

TextJPN: つまり連携が重要であり、そしてそれは、俺たち部活メンバーには最大の武器でもあった。
TextENG: In other words, cooperation is critical, and the greatest weapon we club members have at our disposal.
``Keiichi-kun, they're coming!!@k@vS14/02/210200059. 488, 294!``

TextJPN: 俺は梨花ちゃんがカウントする５秒ルールの前に一度白い円から出てから、再び戻って缶を踏みつけ数字を読み上げる。
TextENG: In accordance with the rules, I stepped out of the white circle before Rika-chan could finish her five second count. Then I went back in to step on the can and call out the numbers.

TextJPN: 続いて魅音に追い立てられた下級生たちが、起死回生を図るべく缶へと殺到してきた。
TextENG: Next, the classmates driven out by Mion rushed toward the can, hoping to plan a comeback.

TextJPN: そして、数分後…。
TextENG: And, a few minutes later...

TextJPN: 「よし、次！」
TextENG: ``All right, next!``
``...Huh?@k@vS14/03/210300124. Is it already over?``

TextJPN: 魅音は缶の周りでうなだれる捕虜の数を数えて、足を止める。下級生たちはあっという間に全員、アウトになっていた。
TextENG: Mion counted the number of prisoners waiting near the can, then came to a halt. In the blink of an eye, all of our underclassmen were out.

TextJPN: 「う～～ん…。@k@vS14/03/210300126.もう少し頑張ってくれると思ってたんだけど…。@k@vS14/03/210300127.ちょっと、見込み違いかなぁ～？」
TextENG: ``Hmm~~...@k@vS14/03/210300126. I thought you guys would put up a better fight...@k@vS14/03/210300127. Maybe I overestimated you~?``

TextJPN: 「おい、そんな言い方はないだろ？」
TextENG: ``Come on, don't say that.``

TextJPN: 「でもさー、これじゃ準備運動にもならないよ」
TextENG: ``But this wasn't even a warm-up.``

TextJPN: しょぼくれてうなだれる下級生を前に、魅音はこめかみをかきながら呆れた声をあげる。
TextENG: Mion called out in a bewildered voice and scratched her head, right in front of our dejected underclassmen.

TextJPN: 見るとレナも沙都子も、汗ひとつかかず息も切らしていない。もちろん、途中からはハンター役に徹していた俺も同様だった。
TextENG: Looking at Rena and Satoko, neither of them were sweating or out of breath. And of course, since I took on the hunter role partway through the game, the same was true for me.

TextJPN: 「なぁ、魅音？@k@vS14/01/210100085.　やっぱもう少し条件を下級生有利にするってのはどうだ？」
TextENG: ``Hey, Mion?@k@vS14/01/210100085. How about changing things up a bit to give the younger students an advantage?``

TextJPN: 「今だって十分有利だよ？@k@vS14/03/210300130.　名前読み上げなくていいんだから。@k@vS14/03/210300131.もし攻守が逆だったら、とっくに私たち缶を蹴飛ばしてるところだよ」
TextENG: ``Don't they already have more than enough of an advantage?@k@vS14/03/210300130. Since we can't just call out their names.@k@vS14/03/210300131. If the teams were reversed, we'd have kicked the can in no time at all.``

TextJPN: 魅音はそう言って、俺の提案を容赦なく切り捨てる。
TextENG: Mion mercilessly shot down my suggestion.

TextJPN: …確かに、俺たちなら一人か二人を陽動に使って、切り込み役がその隙を狙って襲い掛かっているところだ。だから、魅音の言いたいことはわかるんだけど…。
TextENG: ...Indeed, we probably would've sent one or two people to advance, then used that opening to launch a pincer attack. So, I understood what Mion was trying to say...

TextJPN: 「これじゃ、ちょっと入部は難しいね…」
TextENG: ``No one's gonna make the cut at this rate...``

TextJPN: 魅音と俺のやり取りに反応して、さっきまで俯いていた岡村くんがきっ、と顔をあげる。そして、
TextENG: Okamura-kun was hanging his head until a moment ago, but he suddenly raised it in response to my conversation with Mion.

TextJPN: 「もう一度！@k@vS14/25/212500010.　もう一度やらせてください！」
TextENG: ``One more time!@k@vS14/25/212500010. Please, let us try again!``

TextJPN: それを合図に、座り込んでいた下級生たちが一斉に立ち上がった。
TextENG: On that signal, the junior students who were seated on the ground all stood up at once.

TextJPN: 「みんな…！」
TextENG: ``Everyone...!``

TextJPN: 「ほぉ…いいよ？@k@vS14/03/210300134.　でも今の調子なら、何度やっても同じことだけどね～～？」
TextENG: ``Hoh... fine then.@k@vS14/03/210300134. But in your current state, the result will be the same no matter how many times you try, you know~~?``

TextJPN: 「次は違います！@k@vS14/25/212500012.　次こそ勝負です！！」
TextENG: ``Next time will be different!@k@vS14/25/212500012. Next time it'll be a true contest!!``

TextJPN: 岡村くんはそう言って、缶を拾い上げキックオフの構えをする。そして下級生たちは、息を整え駆け出す準備に入った。
TextENG: As he said that, Okamura-kun picked the can up and set it down in position for kickoff. And all the younger students were holding their breath and ready to run.

TextJPN: 「よ～し、それじゃ再戦だ！@k@vS14/03/210300136.　梨花ちゃん、よろしく！！」
TextENG: ``All right~, then it's a rematch!@k@vS14/03/210300136. Rika-chan, it's all on you!!``

TextJPN: 「――はじめ、なのです」
TextENG: ``...Let's begin.``

TextJPN: カコ――――ンッッ！！！
TextENG: *pow*

TextJPN: 梨花ちゃんの声を合図に、岡村くんは缶を思い切り蹴り上げる。そして再び下級生たちは校舎裏へと走り出し、一斉に身を隠した。
TextENG: On Rika's signal, Okamura-kun launched the can into the air. And once again, the younger students immediately ran behind the school building to hide themselves.

TextJPN: 「さぁて、次はどんな策で来るかな…？」
TextENG: ``Alright, what are they planning this time...?``

TextJPN: 魅音は手ぐすね引くようにニヤリと笑いながら、足首をくるくる回して柔軟運動をする。
TextENG: Mion stretched her legs and grinned like she was ready and waiting.

TextJPN: 再び蹴飛ばされた缶をレナが円の中に戻し、余裕たっぷりに数を読みあげる横で、沙都子はこきこきと指を鳴らしていた。
TextENG: Rena returned the can to the circle and began slowly counting out the numbers, and Satoko was standing beside her cracking her knuckles.

TextJPN: 「をっほっほっ！@k@vS14/04/210400114.　通常の缶ケリの戦法ではダメだと、岡村さんたちもわかったはずですわ。@k@vS14/04/210400115.となると、次は――」
TextENG: ``Oh ho ho.@k@vS14/04/210400114. Okamura-kun and the others should have recognized that their usual kick the can strategies would not work here.@k@vS14/04/210400115. Thus, next time...``

TextJPN: 「くっくっく！@k@vS14/03/210300139.　沙都子もそう読むかい？@k@vS14/03/210300140.　なら決まりだね。@k@vS14/03/210300141.圭ちゃん、次のハンター役は私でいくよ！@k@vS14/03/210300142.　圭ちゃんはバックアップ！@k@vS14/03/210300143.　レナ、任せたよ！」
TextENG: ``Hehehe!@k@vS14/03/210300139. You've got the same read on the situation, Satoko?@k@vS14/03/210300140. Then it's decided.@k@vS14/03/210300141. Kei-chan, I'll be the hunter this time!@k@vS14/03/210300142. You'll be on backup!@k@vS14/03/210300143. And Rena, I leave the rest to you!``

TextJPN: 「はう、わかったよ！」
TextENG: ``Hau, got it!``

TextJPN: 「――お？　おおっ！」
TextENG: ``...Oh? Sure!``

TextJPN: よくわからんが、魅音と沙都子は岡村くんたちの作戦が読めたらしい。
TextENG: I'm not sure, but it seems like Mion and Satoko were able to predict Okamura-kun's strategy.

TextJPN: 「けど、どんな作戦で――」
TextENG: ``But, what kind of strategy will it be...?``

TextJPN: ふと、校舎に顔を向ける。すると校舎裏から校庭へと出る左右の物陰から、下級生たちが身を隠さずにこちらをうかがっているのが見えた。
TextENG: Suddenly, I turned to the school building. I could see our underclassmen standing in the shadows on the left and right side of the school building, looking this way with no attempt to hide themselves.

TextJPN: 「「わあぁぁぁぁあぁ――っっ！！！」」
レナの１００カウントが終わった瞬間、下級生たちは徒党を組んで、まるでスクラムのように一斉攻撃を仕掛けてきた！
TextENG: The moment Rena finished her 100 count, the junior students huddled together and launched a mass attack!

TextJPN: 「なるほど…！@k@vS14/01/210100092.　読まれる前に物量攻撃か！！」
TextENG: ``I see...!@k@vS14/01/210100092. So they launched a mass attack before we could read their numbers!!``

TextJPN: 「くっくっく…いい読みだよ」
TextENG: ``Heh heh heh... Good intuition.``

TextJPN: 「でも――まだ不足ッ！！」
TextENG: ``However... that's still not enough!!``

TextJPN: その魅音の言葉を裏付けるように、レナが単身下級生たちの波状の群れに立ち向かう！
TextENG: Supporting Mion's declaration, Rena charged in alone toward the mob of students!

TextJPN: 多勢に、無勢――しかし、そのセオリーともいうべき言葉は、レナの辞書には無いッ！！
TextENG: She was outnumbered... but that word had no meaning in Rena's dictionary!!

TextJPN: すぱぱぱぱ――んっっっ！！！
TextENG: *whoosh*

TextJPN: 「はう～～～、小さい子たちの頑張る姿、かぁいい☆@k@vS14/02/210200063.　お持ち帰りぃぃ～～っっ♪」
TextENG: ``Hau~~~, these little kids are trying so hard, they're sho kyute☆.@k@vS14/02/210200063. I wanna take them home with meee~~♪.``

TextJPN: まさに、一瞬の神技。
TextENG: An immediate display of superhuman skill.

TextJPN: あっという間に下級生たちはグラウンドの上に転がされ、何が起こったのかわからない顔のまま尻餅をついてしまっている。
TextENG: The younger students were down on the ground in no time, and the looks on their faces made it clear they had no idea what happened.

TextJPN: そのうち、女子の何人かはレナのカメレオンのような舌…じゃなかった両腕に抱えられて、かぁいいモードのレナの頬ずりを受けていた。
TextENG: Among them, some of the girls were being squeezed by Rena as she held them in her chameleon-like tongue... no, her arms and rubbed her cheeks against them in her kyute mode.

TextJPN: 「い、今の…レナパンチ使ってないよな？」
TextENG: ``J-just now... she didn't use her Rena Punches, did she?``

TextJPN: 「…みぃ。はっきりとは見えてませんが、倒れた子にあざが出来てないので…。@k@vS14/05/210500101.打撃はなかったと判断しますです」
TextENG: ``...Meep. I wasn't able to get a good look, but none of the fallen children appear to be bruised...@k@vS14/05/210500101. So based on that, I've determined that there were no direct blows.``

TextJPN: とりあえず梨花ちゃんのジャッジで、レナの攻撃は有効と承認。…しかしレナ、あいつは合気道でもやってるのか？
TextENG: For the time being, Rika-chan declared that Rena's attacks were both valid and approved. ...But since when could Rena use aikido?

TextJPN: 「…さすがレナ！@k@vS14/01/210100095.　あいつなら折った箸入れの紙ででも、割り箸を折ることができそうだな！」
TextENG: ``...Excellent work, Rena!@k@vS14/01/210100095. I bet you could even snap chopsticks in half with the paper they're wrapped in!``

TextJPN: 「あー、それどっちらけだよ。@k@vS14/03/210300147.隠した指で折ってるだけだから」
TextENG: ``Aah, that's such a letdown though.@k@vS14/03/210300147. It's just that they use a hidden finger to snap them.``

TextJPN: そんなことを言ってる間に、いち早く回復した富田くんたち男子が立ち上がる。しかし、そのわずかな時間に生まれた隙が、沙都子相手には命取りだった！
TextENG: As we made those comments, Tomita-kun and the other boys quickly rose to their feet. However, Satoko used that brief opportunity to deal the fatal blow!

TextJPN: 「――アウトなのです」
TextENG: ``...You're out.``

TextJPN: 「んなっ？！」
立ち上がって駆け出そうとした瞬間、撃墜を宣告され富田くんたちは呆然と立ちすくむ。
TextENG: Tomita-kun and the others were stunned that they were shot down the moment they tried to get up and run.

TextJPN: そう、レナが一斉攻撃を食い止めている間に沙都子は彼らの背後に回り、起き上がるために無防備に向けた背中を狙い撃ちしたのだ！
TextENG: Indeed, while Rena stopped them with her mass attack, Satoko snuck behind them and took aim at their defenseless backs as they tried to get back up!
``Ah, 691, 574, 164... Heh heh heh. You're completely exposed!!``

TextJPN: そして、沙都子に背中を見せまいと無理な立ち上がりをした子は、反対に缶のところで待ち構えていた魅音に背番号を見られて、あっさりと撃墜される。
TextENG: Then, the students who tried to avoid showing their backs to Satoko as they stood up were in fact pointing their backs toward Mion at the can, so she was able to take them down easily.

TextJPN: 一方、レナに捕まった女の子たちはすでに抵抗もできず、レナに背番号を読み上げられてアウトになった。
TextENG: Meanwhile, the girls Rena was holding lost the will to resist, so Rena was able to read their numbers and get them out.

TextJPN: 「くっくっく！@k@vS14/03/210300152.　狙いは良かったんだけどね、力押しじゃレナに勝てないよ？@k@vS14/03/210300153.　…さて、どうする？　もうギブアップ？」
TextENG: ``Heh heh heh!@k@vS14/03/210300152. It was a good plan, but how can you expect to beat Rena in a contest of force?@k@vS14/03/210300153. ...So, what now? Ready to give up?``

TextJPN: 「くっ…まだです！@k@vS14/24/212400012.　まだ終わりません！！」
TextENG: ``Gh... Not yet!@k@vS14/24/212400012. It's not over yet!!``

TextJPN: 富田くんと岡村くんは、再び立ち上がってこぶしを握り締める。他の子たちも、圧倒的な力の差にショックを受けていたが…それでも、入部の意志は強く二人に続いた。
TextENG: Tomita-kun and Okamura-kun got up again, clenching their fists. The other kids were shocked by the overwhelming difference in power... but even so, their will to join the club was strong enough to follow behind those two.

TextJPN: 「あっはっはっ、いい心構えだね！@k@vS14/03/210300155.　それじゃ泣いて降参、って言うまで叩き潰してあげるよ！！」
TextENG: ``Ahahah, that's a good attitude!@k@vS14/03/210300155. Then I'll just keep crushing you until you surrender in tears!!``

TextJPN: 「お、おい魅音…」
TextENG: ``H-hey, Mion...``

TextJPN: なにもそこまで、と言いかけた俺を制するように、魅音は挑発的に円の中の缶をコンコンとつま先で小突く。その様子が、あまりにも下級生たちを小馬鹿にしているようで…俺は少しだけ、むっとなった。
TextENG: I tried to say ``you're going too far,`` but Mion seemed to interrupt me, provoking them by tapping the can in the circle with her toe. It felt like she was trying to make the younger students look stupid... I was a little offended.

TextJPN: 「さ、次のキックオフは誰かな～？」
TextENG: ``Now, who's going for the next kickoff~?``

TextJPN: …なんとなく、違和感を覚える。
TextENG: ...Somehow, I started to feel uncomfortable.

TextJPN: これまで辿ってきた時間にいた魅音は、少々きつい言葉と態度、そしてどことなく突き放したスタンスで誤解されることもあったが、本当は心の優しく、そして気配り上手な女の子だった。
TextENG: The Mion I've known until now was a little rough with her language and sometimes took a stance that could easily be misunderstood, but deep down she was really a kind-hearted and thoughtful girl.

TextJPN: だからいつも部活でみんなを振り回す一方で、常に下級生たちの様子を気遣うところがあったと思う。
TextENG: So, I think while we're all twisted around her little finger in our club activities, she still ought to be cognizant of the position the younger students are in.

TextJPN: それが、今回に限って…変だ。まるで下級生たちをいじめて、自分の力をひけらかしているようにすら見える。こんな魅音は、今まで見たことが無い。
TextENG: But this time... it was weird. It seemed like she was bullying them just to flaunt her power. I've never seen a Mion like this before.

TextJPN: 「ひょっとして…詩音？@k@vS14/05/VT4Ba_rika1021.　いえ…、そうでもなさそうなのです」
TextENG: ``Maybe... that's actually Shion?@k@vS14/05/VT4Ba_rika1021. No... I don't think that's the case.``

TextJPN: ふと浮かんだ疑問を、すぐに打ち消す。
TextENG: I immediately struck down that thought.

TextJPN: 確かに詩音は以前、よく魅音の姿でこの学校にもぐりこんでいた。それは、雛見沢や園崎の秘密を調べようという意図があってのことだったが…昨日の様子から、それはたぶんなさそうだ。
TextENG: Indeed, Shion did occasionally go to school disguised as Mion. But that was generally with the intention of investigating the secrets of Hinamizawa and the Sonozaki family... and given what I saw yesterday, that was probably not the case.

TextJPN: それに、今の圭一やレナなら、魅音と詩音の区別はすぐにわかってしまえるだろう。
TextENG: Plus, this iteration of Keiichi and Rena should be able to easily recognize the difference between Mion and Shion.

TextJPN: ――だとしたら、やっぱりあれは魅音…？　ますますわからない。
TextENG: ...In which case, that girl is actually Mion...? There's more and more I don't understand.

TextJPN: 新入部員の話も、そうだ。いつもの彼女なら、入部テストなんてことはせずに参加したい子たちは無条件で、受け入れてきたはず。
TextENG: There's also the subject of new club members. Normally, she would've welcomed anyone who wanted to participate, without making them go through an entrance test like this.

TextJPN: それにゲームだって、なんだかんだ言いながら初めは皆平等に楽しめるよう工夫を凝らして、初心者でも入り込みやすい環境を整えていく――それが委員長、園崎魅音だった。
TextENG: Plus, she always tried to choose games that everyone could enjoy equally, setting up an environment where beginners could easily enter... That was our class representative, Mion Sonozaki.

TextJPN: 「この世界は…いったい…？」
TextENG: ``What on earth... is this world...?``

TextJPN: ふと湧いた不安を、疑問に変えて問いかける。
TextENG: My doubts and anxiety suddenly surfaced through that question.

TextJPN: けど、それに答える者はいない。
TextENG: But there was no reply.

TextJPN: ――いや、いつもならいたのだ、確かにこのそばに。それでも今は、返ってくるのはむなしい自分の吐息だけ。
TextENG: ...No, the person who was always by my side would've answered that. But now, all I could do was sigh in vain.
...It's frightening...

TextJPN: ぶるっ、と寒くもないのに震えが全身を駆け巡る。
TextENG: Even though I wasn't cold, my entire body was trembling.

TextJPN: 当たり前が退屈だった。――そう、以前なら。
TextENG: The usual circumstances had become boring. ...Yes, like things were before.

TextJPN: ちょっとした変化が楽しみだった。――そう、ほんの少し前なら。
TextENG: I was looking forward to a bit of a change. ...Right, I was thinking that just a little while ago.

TextJPN: 雨が降るはずの日に雨が降らなかったり、来るはずの無い人が来たりしたとき、…私は心がわくわくした。
TextENG: When it doesn't rain on a day when it's supposed to rain, or when a person who shouldn't come shows up... Those sorts of events excited me.

TextJPN: 退屈と漫然で、気がどうにかなりそうだった日常を面白おかしくしてくれるような予感が、幾千度の繰り返しを続けてきた私の生きがいですらあった。
TextENG: In my callous boredom, those deviations from my predictions made my maddening days feel strangely interesting, even though my life has repeated thousands of times.

TextJPN: なのに…。
TextENG: And yet...

TextJPN: それなのに…。
TextENG: Even so...

TextJPN: 今は、どうしてこんなに不安なの？
TextENG: Why am I feeling so anxious right now?

TextJPN: どうして、こんなに怖くて、寂しくて、悲しいの？
TextENG: Why am I so scared? So lonely? So sad?

TextJPN: 私は、魔女なのに。
TextENG: Even though I'm a witch.

TextJPN: 何千年もの年月を生きて、たくさんの人の運命と、全ての流転をもはや忘れようがないほど見てきて、死の恐怖すら乗り越えた超常の存在のはずなのに――？
TextENG: Even after living for thousands of years, and seeing so many unforgettable changes in the fate of so many people. Even though I should be some supernatural being that has overcome the fear of death...?

TextJPN: 「…どうして……」
私は、問いかける。自分の心に、何度も。
TextENG: I asked the question over and over inside my heart.

TextJPN: どうして。どうして。
TextENG: Why? Why?

TextJPN: どうして、どうして、どうして、どうして、どうして。
TextENG: Why? Why? Why? Why? Why?

TextJPN: どうして、どうして、どうして、どうして、どうして。
TextENG: Why? Why? Why? Why? Why?

TextJPN: どうして、どうして、どうして、どうして、どうして。
TextENG: Why? Why? Why? Why? Why?

TextJPN: ドウシテ、ドウシテ、ドウシテ、ドウシテ、ドウシテ――――。
TextENG: WHY? WHY? WHY? WHY? WHY...?

TextJPN: 壊れた録音機のように問いかけを繰り返す。…でもその答えは、一度も返ってこない。
TextENG: I repeated the question like a broken record. ...But I never received an answer.

TextJPN: そして――――そこでようやく、気づく。
TextENG: And then... I finally realized.

TextJPN: 「…ああ、そうか……」
TextENG: ``Aah, I see...``

TextJPN: 私の心の安定は、常に行き先を示してくれる存在がいたから。
TextENG: The reason my heart was always stable was because I always had a destination.

TextJPN: 空を舞う鳥が、太陽を目印に自分の巣を目指すように。
TextENG: Like how birds in the sky are able to follow the sun to find their nests.

TextJPN: 船が港に入り、澪標に沿ってゆっくりと進むように。
TextENG: Or how a ship pulling into the harbor slowly follows the channel markers.

TextJPN: 私には……羽入が、いた。
TextENG: For me... Hanyuu was always there.

TextJPN: だから安心できた。だから泣いたり、怒ったり、落ち込んだりしても、…なんとか心を元に戻すことができた。
TextENG: So, I felt at ease. Even if I was crying, angry, or depressed... somehow, I was able to get my heart back on the right track.

TextJPN: でも今は、羽入が、…いない。そのせいで、私は今までになかった変化を、物事を、心穏やかに受け止めることができないのだ。
TextENG: But Hanyuu... was no longer here. And because of that, I could no longer calmly accept the changes I'd never seen before.

TextJPN: 詩音が沙都子に、優しくなったことも。
TextENG: Shion being kind to Satoko.

TextJPN: 魅音が下級生たちに、冷たく振舞っていることも。
TextENG: Mion treating the younger classmates coldly.

TextJPN: 今までになかった運命を見ることの楽しさを味わう前に、…この先どうなるかの不安が、まず心をよぎってしまう。
TextENG: Though I used to enjoy the pleasure of witnessing an unprecedented fate... now, it just made me anxious about the future.

TextJPN: …情けない。
TextENG: ...How pathetic.

TextJPN: 私はこんなにも、ちっぽけな存在だったのだろうか…？
TextENG: Was I always such a piddling creature...?

TextJPN: 「――アウトなのです」
TextENG: ``You're out.``

TextJPN: 魅音に促されてアウトを宣告しながら、無表情を装う。正直言って、こみ上げる厭わしさに顔をしかめてしまいそうになる。魅音が何を考えているのかはわからないが、どうしようもなく嫌な気分だった。
TextENG: I disguised my facial expression and responded to Mion's proclamation by calling them out. To be honest, I wanted to vent my disgust with a frown. I couldn't understand what Mion was thinking, but I felt uncomfortable either way.

TextJPN: 勇んで下級生たちの背番号を読み上げ、次々と撃墜していく魅音の嬉しそうな顔が心底、煩わしい。だから私は、とっととこの不愉快な時間が終わることだけを考えていた…。
TextENG: Mion looked delighted as she called out the numbers of the younger students one after another. It was vexing. So, I just kept thinking about when this unpleasant moment would come to an end...

TextJPN: 「…って、あれ？　もう終わり？」
TextENG: ``...Huh? It's over already?``

TextJPN: 沙都子から伝えられた番号を読み上げ、すでに立っている下級生がいないのを確かめてから魅音は、そう言って不敵に笑う。
TextENG: After reading out the numbers Satoko provided her and verifying there were no other younger students left, Mion said that with an audacious smile on her face.

TextJPN: レナも沙都子も、少し額には汗が滲んで息もついていたが、まだまだ体力には余裕がありそうだ。
TextENG: Rena and Satoko were both breathing hard with a little sweat on their foreheads, but they still seemed to have plenty of strength left.

TextJPN: 対して、入部希望の下級生たちは…。
TextENG: On the other hand, the underclassmen hoping to join the club...

TextJPN: 「はぁっ、はぁっ、はぁっ、…っはあっ…！」
TextENG: ``Haah, haah, haah... haah...!``

TextJPN: ついに、富田くんも岡村くんも、膝を地面につけたまま座り込んでしまう。
TextENG: Eventually, Tomita-kun and Okamura-kun knelt down to the ground.

TextJPN: この二人はまだいいほうで、他の子たち…特に年少組の女の子たちは、汗だくで半ベソになりながら荒い息をついていた。
TextENG: Those two were still in good shape, but the other kids... especially the younger girls, were drenched in sweat and half-crying while breathing raggedly.

TextJPN: 胸が痛い。ちくり、といった最初のものではない。じくじくと中からえぐられ、今にも胸板を突き破って飛び出してきそうなほど熱く、喉元がむかつくような痛みを感じた。
TextENG: My chest ached. And this wasn't the first time. The pain was so hot that it was about to burst through my chest at any moment, and I was about to puke.

TextJPN: 「魅ぃちゃん、そろそろ時間…」
TextENG: ``Mii-chan, isn't it about time...?``
``Hmm. Well... what now?@k@vS14/03/210300162. Still want to keep going?``

TextJPN: 「も、もちろんです…！」
TextENG: ``O-of course...!``

TextJPN: 岡村くんと富田くんは、そう言って健気にも立ち上がる。が、他の子はなかなか二人のように立つことができず、中には諦めて俯く子もいた。
TextENG: Okamura-kun and Tomita-kun courageously rose to their feet as they said that. However, the other kids were unable to stand like them. Some had even given up.

TextJPN: その、ちらりと見える表情から、そして仕草から伝わってくる悔しさ。無力感。――なによりも失望からの、諦観。
TextENG: I could sense their bitterness when I caught a glimpse of their expressions. They felt helpless. ...And above all, resignation from despair.

TextJPN: 悔しいのだろう。
TextENG: It must be frustrating.

TextJPN: 腹立たしいのだろう。
TextENG: It must be irritating.

TextJPN: 相手への敵意や嫌悪よりも、…自分の無力さを知ったときが人間にとって一番、はらわたが煮えくり返るのだ。
TextENG: Rather than hostility or hatred for your enemies... what really makes people seethe is when they know that they're helpless.

TextJPN: そして、それでも諦める、屈服する方を選んだ時に、ますますの自己嫌悪を感じて陰鬱な気持ちになってしまう…。
TextENG: And when you finally give in and choose to surrender, you end up feeling more and more of that depressing self-loathing...
``...Hey, Mion.@k@vS14/01/210100099. That's enough...``

TextJPN: 「ダメだよ」
TextENG: ``No good.``

TextJPN: 魅音は全てを聞かず、冷たく言い放つ。その突き放したような言い方に俺はむっ、と顔を向けたが、魅音は涼しい顔のままそれを受け流した。
TextENG: Mion responded coldly and wouldn't listen at all. Her lack of pity ticked me off so I turned toward her, but she brushed me aside with a calm expression.

TextJPN: 「圭ちゃんの気持ちはわかるけどさ。@k@vS14/03/210300165.私たちの仲間になりたいのなら、それだけの実力を伴わないとね」
TextENG: ``Kei-chan, I understand how you feel.@k@vS14/03/210300165. But if you want to be one of us, you need the skills to back it up.``

TextJPN: 「常に諦めない、挫けない、怯まない強い心が私たち部活メンバーに必要なこと！@k@vS14/03/210300167.　だから簡単に諦めたり、最後まで頑張れないヤツは必要ない」
TextENG: ``Our club members need to have a strong heart that won't hesitate, won't be discouraged, and will never give up!@k@vS14/03/210300167. So, we have no need for anyone who will give in easily. Who can't give it their all until the very end.``

TextJPN: 「まして、結果を得られないなんて論外。@k@vS14/03/210300169.ナンセンスだよ」
TextENG: ``Besides, it's out of the question if they can't deliver results.@k@vS14/03/210300169. It's nonsense.``

TextJPN: 「……なんだよ、それ…！」
TextENG: ``...What was that...?!``

TextJPN: 「まぁ、圭一さんは最近負けが込んでますし、敗者の立場になってお考えになりたくなる気持ちもわからないわけじゃありませんけど…。@k@vS14/04/VT4Ba_satoko1014.勝負は勝ってこそ意味があるものでしてよ！」
TextENG: ``Well, Keiichi-san, it's true that you've been losing a lot lately, so I can understand why you'd sympathize with the losers...@k@vS14/04/VT4Ba_satoko1014. But a game only has meaning when you are playing to win!``

TextJPN: 「圭一くん。@k@vS14/02/210200066.――同情してみんなをレナたちの仲間に入れても、実力が違いすぎていつか、楽しめなくなると思うな。@k@vS14/02/210200067.ゲームでも、負けてばかりだとつまんないでしょ？」
TextENG: ``Keiichi-kun.@k@vS14/02/210200066. ...Even if you sympathize with them and want them to join us, the difference in ability is just too great. I don't think they'd enjoy it.@k@vS14/02/210200067. Even if it's just a game, isn't it boring to keep on losing?``

TextJPN: 「――いいか！@k@vS14/00/teach10002.　ゆとり教育とか、個性の尊重なんて教育ぶったやつらが物知り顔で言ってるが、そんなのは弱者のたわごとだ！」
TextENG: ``...Listen!@k@vS14/00/teach10002. People who think they know what they're talking about will speak of stress-free education and respect for individuality, but that's the nonsense of the weak!``

TextJPN: 「意義とかやりがいよりも、受験戦争は勝つことが一番の命題と思え！@k@vS14/00/teach10004.　チャイルディッシュな優しさや平等意識には、何の意味もない！」
TextENG: ``Winning the entrance exam war is far more important than some notion of meaning or satisfaction!@k@vS14/00/teach10004. Your childish affection and fixation on equality are meaningless!``

TextJPN: 「群がってくるやつらを蹴落として、ひたすら勝ちを目指せ！@k@vS14/00/teach10006.　お前たちは――」
TextENG: ``You have to plow through the crowds of enemies and aim for victory!@k@vS14/00/teach10006. All of you...``

TextJPN: 「そういうこと。@k@vS14/03/210300171.だから、もうおしまい」
TextENG: ``That's how it is.@k@vS14/03/210300171. So, there's no point in going any farther.``

TextJPN: 「はい終了～。@k@vS14/03/210300173.そろそろ体育の授業も終わり近いし、クールダウンでもして――」
TextENG: ``All right, we're finished now~.@k@vS14/03/210300173. PE class is almost over, so let's just cool down...``

TextJPN: 「ふざけんじゃねぇぇぇえぇっっ！！」
TextENG: ``Don't give me that bullshiiit!!``

TextJPN: ついに、俺は大声を上げて、怒りをあらわに魅音たちに向き直った。
TextENG: Finally, I turned to Mion and shouted out all my rage.

TextJPN: ――そう、怒りだ！　さっきまでずっと、胸の奥でくすぶっていたこの痛みと不快な思いは、魅音たちに対する怒りだったんだ！
TextENG: ...Yes, rage! The unpleasant, painful sensation smoldering deep in my chest all this time was rage, against Mion and the others!

TextJPN: 頑張れないヤツは要らないだと？
TextENG: No need for people who can't give their all?

TextJPN: 結果を出せないヤツは論外だと？
TextENG: Out of the question if they can't produce results?

TextJPN: 勝負は勝ってこそ？　負けてばかりだとつまんないだと？！
TextENG: Games are only about winning? It's boring if you just lose?!

TextJPN: ふざけんな、ふざけんな、ふざけんな、ふざけんな――っっ！！
TextENG: Bullshit, bullshit, bullshit, bullshit...!!

TextJPN: なんだよ、それは！　まるで、俺が東京で過ごしてきた昔とおんなじじゃねぇか！！
TextENG: What's with that?! That's just like the old days when I was back in Tokyo!!

TextJPN: 結果が全て。
TextENG: Results are everything.

TextJPN: 他人よりひとつでも上なら、なんでもよし。
TextENG: Anything is fine to put yourself above others.

TextJPN: だから、勝ち負けと優劣にこだわって、明け暮れて、埋没して――。
TextENG: So just focus on winning and being superior, devoting all your time to that, burying yourself in it...

TextJPN: そのうち、なんで自分が戦っているのか…その意義を見失って、宙ぶらりんになって…しまいにはその勝負すら、面白くなくなったんじゃないか。
TextENG: Before long, I lost sight of what I was fighting for... It lost its significance and was just left hanging there... In the end, the competition stopped being fun altogether, didn't it?

TextJPN: ――いや、俺の過去はどうでもいい。もう、俺はそれを捨ててきたんだから。
TextENG: ...No, I don't give a damn about my past. I've already cast it aside.

TextJPN: でも、俺が一番…何よりも認めたくなくて、否定したいことを仲間の魅音や、レナや、沙都子の口が言うのだけは我慢がならねぇっ！！
TextENG: But... I can't stand that my friends Mion, Rena, and Satoko are the ones saying the things I really want to deny more than anything else!

TextJPN: だって、そうだろ？！
TextENG: After all, I'm right about this, aren't I?!

TextJPN: 頑張れないヤツは、立ち上がるまで応援してやる。挫けそうな時は肩を貸して、頑張る楽しさを教えてやればいい。
TextENG: If someone can't give it their all, I'll support them until they can stand back up. If they're feeling discouraged, I'll lend them a shoulder and tell them to do their best and have fun.

TextJPN: 結果を出せないなら、出すまでずっと、付き合ってやる。諦めたくなったらハードルを下げて、ゴールにたどり着く嬉しさを与えてやればいい。
TextENG: If they can't get results, I'll stay beside them until they can. If they want to give up, we should lower the hurdle and give them the joy of reaching the goal.

TextJPN: そして、どうしても勝てないやつがいたら？　――それこそナンセンスだ！　一人で勝てないなら、二人で！　それでもダメなら、その倍の四人で！　そして――！
TextENG: And so what if there's someone who can't win? ...That's nonsense! If you can't win alone, work with someone else! And if that's not enough, bring four times as many! Then...!

TextJPN: 「――雛見沢の、伝統…」
TextENG: ``...That's the Hinamizawa tradition...``

TextJPN: 「一人に石を投げられたら、二人で石を投げ返せ。@k@vS14/01/210100105.二人に石を投げられたら、四人で石を。@k@vS14/01/210100106.八人に棒で追われたら、十六人で追い返し。@k@vS14/01/210100107.三十人に中傷されたなら、六十人で怒鳴り返せ」
TextENG: ``If stones are being thrown at someone, then two will throw them back.@k@vS14/01/210100105. And if two throw stones, then four will respond.@k@vS14/01/210100106. If eight people are being chased with sticks, then 16 will chase them back. @k@vS14/01/210100107. If 30 people are being slandered, 60 will yell back.``

TextJPN: 「千人に襲われたなら、雛見沢の全員で立ち向かえ。…だったよな？」
TextENG: ``If you were attacked by a thousand people, then all of Hinamizawa would fight back. ...Isn't that right?``

TextJPN: 「圭一くん――」
TextENG: ``Keiichi-kun...``

TextJPN: 「それが雛見沢の心意気だ！@k@vS14/01/210100110.　だから俺は決めた！@k@vS14/01/210100111.　こいつら全員を、俺たちの仲間にする！@k@vS14/01/210100112.　たとえお前らが拒んでも！！」
TextENG: ``That's the spirit of Hinamizawa!@k@vS14/01/210100110. So, I've decided!@k@vS14/01/210100111. All of them are going to join us!@k@vS14/01/210100112. Whether you accept it or not!!``

TextJPN: 「そして諦めない強さと、勝つ喜びを最後までずっと、手に入れるまでこいつらに教え続けてやる！！！」
TextENG: ``And I'll continue to teach them to have the strength to keep fighting, until they're finally able to achieve the joy of victory!!!``

TextJPN: 「け、圭一さっ――」
TextENG: ``K-Keiichi-sa...``

TextJPN: 沙都子がなにか口を挟もうとしたが、それを制して魅音が俺の前に立つ。そして、ニヤリと不敵な笑いを浮かべて言った。
TextENG: Satoko tried to squeeze a few words out, but Mion immediately stepped in front of me. Then, a grin floated to her face as she responded.

TextJPN: 「へぇ、圭ちゃん。@k@vS14/03/210300176.ずいぶんと立派なことを言えるようになったねぇ？@k@vS14/03/210300177.　いやいやすごいすごい！@k@vS14/03/210300178.　おじさん感動して涙が出てきちゃいそうだよ」
TextENG: ``Wow, Kei-chan.@k@vS14/03/210300176. You've got a lot of fine things to say.@k@vS14/03/210300177. No, they're truly amazing!@k@vS14/03/210300178. This ol' man has been moved, to the point of tears.``

TextJPN: 「…でも、わかってる？@k@vS14/03/210300180.　圭ちゃん一人が粋がっても、私たちは納得したりしないよ。@k@vS14/03/210300181.どうする？」
TextENG: ``But... you understand, right?@k@vS14/03/210300180. Even if you're being considerate of them, that doesn't mean you've convinced the rest of us.@k@vS14/03/210300181. So, what are you going to do?``

TextJPN: その物言いに、一瞬、…ほんの一瞬だけ、俺は目の前の魅音が憎くて腹立たしくて、たまらなくなる。
TextENG: The moment she said that... just for that one brief moment, I hated the unbearably annoying Mion standing before me.

TextJPN: 目の前にいるのは、本当に俺が最高の仲間と信じた園崎魅音か？！　…そんな疑いと失望から、絶交を言い渡してやろうかと思った。
TextENG: Was the person standing before me really my best friend Mion Sonozaki?! ...With my doubts and disappointment nagging at me, I considered denouncing our friendship right there.

TextJPN: だが、思い直す。それじゃ、ダメだと。
TextENG: But thinking it over, that was a bad idea.

TextJPN: 嫌いだから、近づかない。腹立たしいから、関係を絶つ。…でもそれは、魅音たちに勝てないことを認めて、逃げているだけだ。
TextENG: Keeping your distance because you don't like something. Cutting off a relationship because you're annoyed. ...Doing that would just be running away and admitting I couldn't win against Mion and the others.

TextJPN: だったら――――手段はひとつ、だよな？！
TextENG: If that's the case... then there's only one thing to do!

TextJPN: 「――ああ、わかってるさ。@k@vS14/01/210100115.俺たち部活メンバーのルール…『勝ったほうが正義』！！@k@vS14/01/210100116.　だから、俺がこいつらを勝たせてやる！！！」
TextENG: ``...Yeah, I understand.@k@vS14/01/210100115. The rules of our club... ``whoever wins is right!!``@k@vS14/01/210100116. So, I'll make them win!!!``

TextJPN: 「ほう――言ったね、圭ちゃん？@k@vS14/03/210300183.　断っておくけど、私たち相手に戦うってことは、それ相応の覚悟をしてもらうことになるよ？」
TextENG: ``Hoh... them's fighting words, Kei-chan?@k@vS14/03/210300183. Just so you know, you'd better be fully prepared to fight against us, okay?``

TextJPN: 「もちろん！@k@vS14/01/210100118.　どんな罰ゲームでも何でも、ドンと持ってきやがれ！！@k@vS14/01/210100119.　――その代わり、俺が勝ったらいいな？@k@vS14/01/210100120.　恨みっこ無しで俺の要求を、無条件で呑んでもらうぜ？！」
TextENG: ``Of course!@k@vS14/01/210100118. No matter what the punishment is, bring it on!!@k@vS14/01/210100119. ...On the other hand, are you prepared for the possibility I'll win?@k@vS14/01/210100120. Are you willing to unconditionally accept my demands, with no hard feelings?!``

TextJPN: 「信賞必罰は守るよ。@k@vS14/03/210300185.私たち３人以外の誰かが缶を蹴ることができたら、圭ちゃんの勝ちだ！」
TextENG: ``No service will go unrewarded, and no fault unpunished.@k@vS14/03/210300185. If anyone other than the three of us manages to kick the can, then Kei-chan wins!``

TextJPN: 「――もっとも、その必要は限りなくゼロに近いけどね！　くっくっく…！！」
TextENG: ``...Of course, the chances of that are all but nothing! Heh heh heh...!!``

TextJPN: 「その言葉、忘れるなよ！@k@vS14/01/210100122.　――よぅし、みんなっ！！」
TextENG: ``Don't forget what you just said!@k@vS14/01/210100122. ...All right, everyone!!``

TextJPN: 俺は力強く振り返って、意気消沈している下級生たちに向き直った。
TextENG: I vigorously turned around and faced the despondent underclassmen.

TextJPN: 皆一様に、疲れ切った顔をしている。中腰ながら見上げて立つ富田くん、岡村くんはまだいいほうで、ほとんどの子は地面に座り込んだまま、顔すら上げることも難しい様子だった。
TextENG: Every last one of them looked exhausted. Tomita-kun and Okamura-kun were still half-standing and looking up, but most of them were still on the ground, struggling to even hold their heads up.

TextJPN: だが…あえて俺は、彼らを奮い立たせる。
TextENG: Even so... I dared to inspire them.

TextJPN: そう、人間は――気持ちが折れたときが本当の負けなんだから！！
TextENG: That's the thing about humans... you've only truly lost when your spirit is broken!!

TextJPN: 「まだ動けるのはどれだけだ？@k@vS14/01/210100124.　――遠慮しなくていい、きついやつは休め！@k@vS14/01/210100125.　恥じることは無い、みんな頑張った！@k@vS14/01/210100126.　本当に良く頑張った！！」
TextENG: ``How many of you can still move?@k@vS14/01/210100124. ...No need to be shy, those of you who've been through a lot can rest!@k@vS14/01/210100125. You have nothing to be ashamed of, every last one of you did your best!@k@vS14/01/210100126. You truly gave it your all!!``

TextJPN: 「ま、前原さん…」
TextENG: ``M-Maebara-san...``

TextJPN: 「今疲れ切ってるみんなにもう一度立ち上がれと言うのは、酷かもしれない！@k@vS14/01/210100128.　それはわかってる！@k@vS14/01/210100129.　それに腰を上げたところで、動くことすらきついと思う。@k@vS14/01/210100130.それもわかってる！」
TextENG: ``It's cruel of me to ask everyone who's exhausted to get back up again!@k@vS14/01/210100128. I realize that!@k@vS14/01/210100129. And even if you can stand, it'll be hard to even move.@k@vS14/01/210100130. I realize that too!``

TextJPN: 「――だが、あえて言わせてくれ、みんな！！@k@vS14/01/210100132.　俺は…」
TextENG: ``...But everyone, let me tell you this!!@k@vS14/01/210100132. I...``

TextJPN: 俺は、その場に膝を付いて、…力づけたい、励ましたい思いをこめて言った。
TextENG: I knelt down on the spot... and spoke with all my heart, hoping to encourage them.

TextJPN: 「俺は――みんなと部活がしたい！@k@vS14/01/210100134.　だからみんな、俺に力を、たった一度でいいから力を貸してくれ！！」
TextENG: ``I... want all of you to join the club!@k@vS14/01/210100134. So everyone, lend me your power. Just this once, let me borrow your strength!!``

TextJPN: 「認めさせたいんだ、あいつらに！@k@vS14/01/210100136.　ここまで頑張ったみんなの気持ちを、思いを、そして心意気を！！」
TextENG: ``I want all of you to be acknowledged!@k@vS14/01/210100136. Your feelings, your thoughts, and your spirit after giving your all this whole time!!``

TextJPN: 「このままじゃ終われない、終わらせたくない！@k@vS14/01/210100138.　だからほんのちょっとでいい、俺を信じてくれ！！@k@vS14/01/210100139.　そしてあと一回だけ、勝利を信じる気持ちを奮い起こしてくれ！！！」
TextENG: ``I don't want it to end like this!@k@vS14/01/210100138. So I need you to believe in me, just a little!!@k@vS14/01/210100139. And just one more time, show me the inspiration of believing in victory!!!``

TextJPN: 「考えろ！@k@vS14/01/210100141.　考えるんだ！@k@vS14/01/210100142.　相手はほんのちょっと、たった数年だけ先に生まれただけの、頭も身体もそんなに違いが無いやつだろ？」
TextENG: ``Think!@k@vS14/01/210100141. Think it over!@k@vS14/01/210100142. Your opponents are only a few years older. Is the difference in mind and body really that significant?``

TextJPN: 「――みんな、魅音や沙都子と勉強で勝負して、負けてばかりか？@k@vS14/01/210100144.　そうじゃないだろ？！」
TextENG: ``...Everyone, have you been constantly losing to Mion and Satoko when it comes studying?@k@vS14/01/210100144. You haven't, right?!``

TextJPN: 「……私、カリフラワーとブロッコリーの違い、わかるもん！」
TextENG: ``...I know the difference between cauliflower and broccoli!``

TextJPN: そう、俯いていた女の子の１人が顔を上げて、ポツリと言う。俺はその子の肩を持つと、『そうだっ！！』と優しく、そして力強くどやしつけた。
TextENG: One of the downtrodden girls raised her head and spoke up. I gave her a gentle, yet powerful pat on the shoulder and said, ``That's right!!``

TextJPN: 「しかも相手は４人！@k@vS14/01/210100146.　――いや、今は１人減って、３人だ！@k@vS14/01/210100147.　そしてそのうちの１人は、ハンター役で缶のそばから動けない！」
TextENG: ``Moreover, there are only four opponents!@k@vS14/01/210100146. ...No, they're losing one, so they're down to three!@k@vS14/01/210100147. And the one playing the role of the hunter can't move away from the can!``

TextJPN: 「だから注意すべきはたった２人！！@k@vS14/01/210100149.　――わかるか、富田くん、岡村くん！@k@vS14/01/210100150.　君たち二人と同数なんだ！！」
TextENG: ``So there are only two people to watch out for!!@k@vS14/01/210100149. ...Do you understand, Tomita-kun, Okamura-kun?!@k@vS14/01/210100150. That's the same number as the two of you!!``

TextJPN: 「で、でも…竜宮さん相手だと…」
TextENG: ``B-but... the enemy is Ryuugu-san...``

TextJPN: 「そうだ。確かにレナは脅威だ。@k@vS14/01/210100152.――だから俺が、レナを食い止める。@k@vS14/01/210100153.そうすれば君たちが戦う相手は、――沙都子１人ッ！！」
TextENG: ``That's true. Rena is certainly a threat.@k@vS14/01/210100152. ...So, I'll stop Rena myself.@k@vS14/01/210100153. That way, you only need to fight a single person... Satoko!!``

TextJPN: 「そ、そうかっ…！」
それを聞いて、ようやく元気を失いかけていた二人の顔が、ぱっと明るくなる。それにつられて、徐々に俯いていた下級生たちも、顔を上げて俺を見つめはじめた。
TextENG: Even though those two had gradually been losing their energy, their faces brightened up after hearing that. And at the same time, the younger students on the ground slowly began to raise their heads and look up at me.

TextJPN: ――よし、もう一息だ！
TextENG: ...All right, one more time!

TextJPN: 「いいか、みんな！　『走る』必要はもう無い！@k@vS14/01/210100155.　俺と富田くん、岡村くんが猟犬役の二人を食い止める！」
TextENG: ``Ok, everyone! There's no need to run!@k@vS14/01/210100155. Tomita-kun, Okamura-kun, and I will handle the two hounds!``

TextJPN: 「だからみんなは、ただひとつ――缶だけを狙え！！@k@vS14/01/210100157.　魅音のタッチを恐れるな！@k@vS14/01/210100158.　相手は二本の手しかないぞ！！」
TextENG: ``So, the rest of you have a single job... aim for the can!!@k@vS14/01/210100157. Don't be afraid of being tagged by Mion!@k@vS14/01/210100158. Your opponent only has two hands!!``

TextJPN: 「は、はいっっ！！！」
TextENG: ``R-right!!!``

TextJPN: 「それじゃ、みんな――」
TextENG: ``All right, everyone...``

TextJPN: 俺は手を差し出す。真っ先に富田くん、岡村くんがその手に自分の手を重ねて、そしてそれをきっかけに全員が、力強く小さな手を重ねていった。
TextENG: I held out my hand. First, Tomita-kun and Okamura-kun put their hands on top. And then, all of them put their strong little hands together.
``This is our last chance.@k@vS14/01/210100161. ...Everyone, let's go!!@k@vS14/01/210100162. This is the final battle!!!``

TextJPN: …なんということだろう。
TextENG: ...Incredible.

TextJPN: 私は、今見ている光景がにわかには、信じられなかった。
TextENG: I couldn't believe what I was seeing.
``...It can't be...!``

TextJPN: 下級生たちは、ついさっきまで皆一様に、気落ちしていたのだ。
TextENG: All of the younger students were in poor spirits just a moment ago.

TextJPN: さすがに口にこそ出さなかったが、疲労と無力感から立ち上がる気力を失い、戦っても勝ち目が無いと入部を半分、いやほとんど諦めたような表情をしていた。
TextENG: They wouldn't outright say it, but they had lost the energy to even stand from the fatigue and helplessness. They thought even if they fought, they had no chance of winning. They were halfway, maybe even completely ready to give up.

TextJPN: それが、どうだろう。
TextENG: But despite that.

TextJPN: 圭一の一言で、再び最初のときと同じくらい、もしかしたらそれ以上の力強さと気迫をみなぎらせて、へたり込んだ腰を上げ、べっとりと付いた土を払って立ち上がっている。
TextENG: After just a few words from Keiichi, they were getting on their feet again and wiping the dirt from their shorts, with the same level of strength they had from the very beginning. Maybe even stronger.

TextJPN: 本当のことを言うと…私は彼らのことを、情けないとさえ思っていた。
TextENG: To tell the truth... even I thought they looked pathetic.

TextJPN: ちょっとした壁にぶつかって、ふさぎこんで。
TextENG: They hit a little wall and began to mope.

TextJPN: それでも負けを認めたくないから、…現実を受け入れたくないから顔を伏せて、誰かから同情を向けられるのを待っているかのような、卑屈な態度。
TextENG: Still, they didn't want to accept defeat... they didn't want to accept that reality, so they turned their heads down and waited for someone to sympathize with them. Such a sycophantic attitude.

TextJPN: 実際は、そうじゃないかもしれない。でも、そうにしか見えない。
TextENG: Perhaps that's not the case, but I couldn't see it any other way.

TextJPN: いやに尊大ぶる魅音も見ていて不愉快だったが、そんな下級生たちを目の当たりにし続けるのも正直、うんざりしていたところだ。
TextENG: I loathed watching Mion behave so haughtily, but honestly watching the younger students was just as tedious.

TextJPN: だから私は、内心顔を背けながら…考えることを止めて、時間が過ぎるまでじっとしてようと、思った。
TextENG: So, I simply turned my gaze inward... I stopped thinking and wanted to just stand still waiting for time to pass.

TextJPN: ――でも、圭一はそうじゃなかった。
TextENG: ...But Keiichi wasn't like that.

TextJPN: 彼らの可能性を信じて、仲間たちと敵対してでも。…彼らに手を差し伸べることを、選んだ。
TextENG: He believed in their potential, and went so far as to stand up to his friends... in order to choose to reach a hand out to them.

TextJPN: それは、目上の優位な立場からの、『お恵み』なんかじゃない。安易な同情とは決して違う…優しく、そして強い励ましの、心。
TextENG: It wasn't the ``grace`` of a higher being. It wasn't cheap sympathy... It was kind, but strong encouragement, from deep in his heart.

TextJPN: だからみんな、立ち上がった。
TextENG: So, everyone was able to get up again.

TextJPN: 自分の意志で、強制されることなく、もう一度戦う意志を取り戻したのだ。
TextENG: They weren't forced into it. They did it of their own volition. They regained the will to fight.

TextJPN: 「やっぱり…それでこそ、圭一なのです」
TextENG: ``After all... that's Keiichi for you.``

TextJPN: 変わらない。
TextENG: That never changes.

TextJPN: 圭一だけは、どの時間でも、どの立場でも…決して、変わらない。
TextENG: No matter the time, no matter the place... Keiichi never changes.

TextJPN: その強い思いが空回りして、暴走して…悲劇を起こしたことも、確かにある。それでも、圭一はずっと、最後の最後まで運命と、戦い続けていた。
TextENG: His strong convictions spin around and go out of control... which certainly can lead to tragedy. Still, Keiichi continued fighting fate until the very end.

TextJPN: そして、その強さがあるからこそ――周りの人は、彼の存在を無視できないのだと、心から思うのだ。
TextENG: And, because of his strength... the people around him simply can't ignore him. Deep down, I believe that.

TextJPN: 「……圭一。@k@vS14/05/VT4Ba_rika1029.あなたなら、見せてくれますですか？@k@vS14/05/VT4Ba_rika1030.　不愉快な時間を打ち破る、ちっぽけな奇跡を――！」
TextENG: ``...Keiichi.@k@vS14/05/VT4Ba_rika1029. Could you be the one to finally show it to me?@k@vS14/05/VT4Ba_rika1030. The small miracle that can tear down this detestable time...!``

TextJPN: 目の前では、圭一がキックオフの構えで缶を構えている。
TextENG: Right before my eyes, Keiichi was holding the can in kick-off position.

TextJPN: それを見ながら、私は…どこか心が高揚していく自分に、ちょっとだけ驚いていた。
TextENG: As I looked onward... surprisingly enough, I could feel my heart getting lighter.
``Alright, let's go!@k@vS14/01/210100164. Yaaah...!!``

TextJPN: カァ――――ンッッ！！！
TextENG: *pooow*

TextJPN: 小気味良い音を立てて、空き缶が宙に舞う。それと同時に下級生たちは校舎裏へとダッシュし、続いてレナと沙都子が缶を追いかけようとする――。
TextENG: A cool sound rang out as the empty can danced through the air. The younger students dashed to the back of the school building while Rena and Satoko chased after the can...

TextJPN: 「――ちょっと待て、レナ、沙都子！」
TextENG: ``...Hold on Rena, Satoko!``

TextJPN: 「はうっ？！」
「な、なんですの？！」
TextENG: ``Wh-what?!``

TextJPN: 「缶を取ってからのカウントダウンは省略していい。@k@vS14/01/210100167.その代わり、この問題を解いてから缶を取りにいけ！！」
TextENG: ``Once you recover the can, you can skip the countdown.@k@vS14/01/210100167. But in exchange, you can't go for the can until you solve this problem!!``

TextJPN: 「な、なにかな？　かな？」
TextENG: ``Wh-what could it be? What could it be?``

TextJPN: 「問題だ！@k@vS14/01/210100169.　１分間に二つに分裂する細菌がある。@k@vS14/01/210100170.これを瓶に詰めると、１時間で一杯になる。@k@vS14/01/210100171.――さて！　この細菌を瓶に２つ入れたら、何分で瓶一杯になるか？！」
TextENG: ``Here's the problem!@k@vS14/01/210100169. There are bacteria that split in two once per minute.@k@vS14/01/210100170. If you put one in a jar, the jar will be full after one hour. @k@vS14/01/210100171. ...But! If you put two of those bacteria in the jar, how long will it take to fill it?!``

TextJPN: 「え、え、そ、それは…！」
TextENG: ``H-huuh, w-well...!``

TextJPN: 「な、なんですの、その奇ッ怪な問題はっ？！」
TextENG: ``Wh-why are you asking such a bizarre question?!``

TextJPN: 「くっくっく…圭ちゃん、いつもの引っ掛けたナゾナゾだね？@k@vS14/03/210300188.　残念だけどおじさんはひっかからないよ！」
TextENG: ``Heh heh heh... Kei-chan, you're trying to trick us with one of your conventional riddles?@k@vS14/03/210300188. Sorry, but this ol' man won't be caught in your web!``

TextJPN: 「正解は――――シンプルに考えて１時間の半分の３０分！！」
TextENG: ``The answer... is simple, once you think about it. It's half an hour! 30 minutes!!``

TextJPN: 「残念、不正解だ。@k@vS14/01/210100173.…というわけで、その問題が解けるまで缶を取りに行くなよ？」
TextENG: ``Sorry, wrong answer.@k@vS14/01/210100173. ...By the way, you're not allowed to go for the can until you get the answer right, okay?``

TextJPN: 「え？　ええっ？　ど、どして？？@k@vS14/03/210300191.　二つに増やしたんだから時間も半分でしょー？！」
TextENG: ``Huh? Huuuh? W-why??@k@vS14/03/210300191. There are twice as many of them so it should happen in half the time, riiight!``

TextJPN: 「それじゃ梨花ちゃん、正解が言えるまでちゃんと見張っておいてくれよ？」
TextENG: ``All right, Rika-chan, keep an eye on them until they get the right answer, ok?``

TextJPN: 「了解なのです。にぱー☆」
TextENG: ``Roger. Nipah☆.``

TextJPN: 梨花ちゃんはおかしそうに笑いながら、手を振ってくれた。…ちなみに梨花ちゃんにだけは、正解を教えてある。
TextENG: Rika-chan waved her hand with a weird-looking smile on her face. ...Incidentally, Rika-chan was the only person I told the correct answer.

TextJPN: 「え、えっと…。@k@vS14/03/210300193.１時間は６０分だから、二倍の速さになれば３０分…だよね？」
TextENG: ``U-umm...@k@vS14/03/210300193. One hour is 60 minutes, so if you double the speed it'll take 30 minutes... right?``
``H-hau~!@k@vS14/02/210200073. Rena is no good at math~!``

TextJPN: 「ちょ、ちょっと梨花！@k@vS14/04/210400124.　笑ってないでヒントだけでも教えてくださいませ！」
TextENG: ``H-hold on, Rika!@k@vS14/04/210400124. Do not laugh at us like that. Please, give us just a small hint!``

TextJPN: 「審判は公正なのです。にぱ～♪」
TextENG: ``The referee must remain neutral. Nipah~♪.``

TextJPN: …後ろでは魅音たちが、まだ喧々諤々の相談をしている。おそらく普通に１００数えるよりも、大幅に時間を稼げるだろう。
TextENG: ...Mion and the others were still busy discussing it behind me. This may give us even more time than the 100 count normally would.

TextJPN: 俺はダッシュで校舎裏に滑り込む。そこには、富田くんと岡村くんが待っていた。
TextENG: I dashed to the back of the school building, where Tomita-kun and Okamura-kun were waiting.

TextJPN: 「前原さん、準備ＯＫです！」
TextENG: ``Maebara-san, preparations are complete!``

TextJPN: 「女子は全員、教室に。@k@vS14/25/212500019.男子の残りは、校舎の反対側に行きました！」
TextENG: ``All the girls are in the classroom.@k@vS14/25/212500019. And the other boys have gone to the other side of the school building!``

TextJPN: 「よし…ここは時間が勝負だ！@k@vS14/01/210100176.　二人とも、仕掛けは万全か？」
TextENG: ``All right... it's time to win this!@k@vS14/01/210100176. Are both of you ready for our tactic?``

TextJPN: 「「ばっちりです！！」」
TextENG: ````Good to go!!````

TextJPN: 二人は同時に親指を立ててにやりと笑う。それを見て、俺は大きく頷きその手を握った。
TextENG: The two of them smiled at the same time and flashed me a thumbs up. After seeing that, I nodded and grabbed their hands.

TextJPN: 「よぅし！@k@vS14/01/210100178.　俺たちは今から同志だ！@k@vS14/01/210100179.　俺のことは前原じゃなく、圭一と呼べ！」
TextENG: ``All riiight!@k@vS14/01/210100178. We're comrades now!@k@vS14/01/210100179. Don't call me Maebara. Call me Keiichi!``

TextJPN: 「はい、圭一さん！@k@vS14/24/212400023.　僕のことも、大樹でお願いします！！」
TextENG: ``Okay, Keiichi-san!@k@vS14/24/212400023. And please, call me Daiki!!``

TextJPN: 「僕も傑で！！@k@vS14/25/212500022.　圭一さん、あなたに全て託します！！」
TextENG: ``And call me Suguru!!@k@vS14/25/212500022. I'll leave everything to you, Keiichi-san!!``

TextJPN: 二人は両手で固く、俺の手を握り締める。俺はもう一方の手をその上に乗せて、『おおっ！！』と力強く返した。
TextENG: The two of them firmly placed their hands on mine. I put my other hand on top and shouted, ``Yeaaah!!``

TextJPN: 校舎の陰から、魅音たちを見る。ようやく解けたのか、レナが拾った缶を円の中に運んでいた。
TextENG: I could see Mion and the others from the far side of the school building. They must've finally solved it, because Rena was carrying the can back to the circle.

TextJPN: 心なしか、レナの頭からぷしゅー、と煙が吹き出しているような…沙都子は沙都子で、遠目でわかるほど顔を真っ赤にしているし。
TextENG: It seemed like smoke was about to come blowing out of Rena's head... And Satoko was being Satoko. Her face was so bright red I could see it clearly from here.

TextJPN: そして、魅音は…なんか苦笑いしてるようだな。しかしその目はまっすぐ、俺のいる方向をとらえて動かない。きっと俺がここに潜んでのぞき込んでいるのも、全てお見通しなんだろう。
TextENG: And Mion... seemed to be laughing, but her eyes were constantly pointing straight in this direction. She must be certain I'm lurking back here and constantly on watch.

TextJPN: さて…勝負だ！　部活メンバーたちっっ！！！
TextENG: Now... let the game begin! Club members!!!
``All forces...``

TextJPN: 俺は、ゆっくりと手を上げ――――そして、前に勢いよく突き出して叫んだ！
TextENG: I slowly raised my hand...... and then vigorously shouted and pointed forward!

TextJPN: 「突撃ぃぃぃッッッ！！！」
TextENG: ``Attaaaack!!!``

TextJPN: 「「わぁぁぁああぁぁ――っっっ！！」」
TextENG: ````Aaaaaaaahhh!!````

TextJPN: 喚声とともに、俺たち本隊と別働隊が、同時に缶をめがけて突進する。それを迎撃するかのように、レナと沙都子がいち早く距離をつめ、先に接近した別働隊めがけてレナが攻撃を開始した！
TextENG: With that cry, all our separate teams rushed toward the can at once. Rena and Satoko quickly moved in to intercept. Rena moved toward the corps that had approached earlier and began her attack!

TextJPN: 「来たね来たね！@k@vS14/02/210200075.　あはははは、一斉に来ても無駄無駄無駄ァァッッ！！」
TextENG: ``You're here, you're here!@k@vS14/02/210200075. Ahahahaha, even if you approach all at once it's useless, useless, useleeeess!!``

TextJPN: すぱぱぱぱ――――んっっっ！！！
TextENG: *pow* *pow* *pow*

TextJPN: あっという間に目にも止まらない動きで、なぎ倒されていく別働隊。そしてうめきながらも、何とか起き上がる彼らの背番号を読み上げるべく、沙都子が軍勢の背後に回る！
TextENG: The detached corps was overwhelmed by that unstoppable advance. And while they groaned and tried to stand up, Satoko moved in behind them to read their numbers!

TextJPN: 「をっほっほっほっ！@k@vS14/04/210400126.　一斉攻撃とは芸の無い…、」
TextENG: ``Oh ho ho ho!@k@vS14/04/210400126. There is no elegance to a mass attack...``

TextJPN: 「んなっ？！」
「ど、どうしたの沙都子！@k@vS14/03/210300195.　早く数字をっ！」
TextENG: ``W-what happened? Satoko!@k@vS14/03/210300195. Get their numbers, quick!``
``...Wrong.@k@vS14/05/210500117. Invalid answer.``

TextJPN: 梨花ちゃんが胸の前で、バッテンを作る。それを見て、余計に焦った沙都子は数人の背番号を読み間違え、梨花ちゃんに無効判定されていた。
TextENG: Rika-chan formed an X in front of her chest with her arms. When she saw that, Satoko panicked and mistakenly read several people's numbers. Rika-chan declared her answers invalid.

TextJPN: 「ど、どうしたの沙都子ちゃん？@k@vS14/02/210200077.　ちゃんと読み上げなきゃダメだよ？　だよ？」
TextENG: ``W-what's the problem, Satoko-chan?@k@vS14/02/210200077. You have to read them properly, you know? You know?``

TextJPN: 「だ、だって！@k@vS14/04/VT4Ba_satoko1017.　せ、背番号が逆さまなんですのよ～～っっ？！」
TextENG: ``W-well!@k@vS14/04/VT4Ba_satoko1017. Th-the numbers on their backs are upside-down~~!``

TextJPN: 「ええぇえっっ？！」
TextENG: ``Huuuuh?!``

TextJPN: そう、さっきの時間稼ぎの理由は、背番号のゼッケンを全員逆にさせることが『ひとつ』だった！！
TextENG: Yes, ``one`` of the reasons for buying that extra time earlier was so that we could invert everyone's player numbers!!

TextJPN: 「け、圭ちゃん…やってくれたねぇ～！@k@vS14/03/210300197.　――審判ッ！！」
TextENG: ``K-Kei-chan... Oh no you didn't~!@k@vS14/03/210300197. ...Referee!!``

TextJPN: 「はっは！@k@vS14/01/210100183.　背番号の付ける向きは指示なかったし。@k@vS14/01/210100184.――だよな、梨花ちゃん？」
TextENG: ``Haha!@k@vS14/01/210100183. The rules said nothing about the direction of the numbers.@k@vS14/01/210100184. ...Right, Rika-chan?``

TextJPN: 「――ＯＫです。@k@vS14/05/210500119.ノージャッジなのですよ」
TextENG: ``...It's OK.@k@vS14/05/210500119. No violation.``

TextJPN: 梨花ちゃんがにこやかに大きく頭上で『マル』を作る。その間に、沙都子の撃墜を逃れた数人の別働隊が完全に復活し、再び缶めがけて襲い掛かった！！
TextENG: Rika-chan had a huge smile on her face as her arms formed a circle overhead. Meanwhile, a few of the troops who had escaped Satoko's initial shootout were on the move again, resuming the attack!!

TextJPN: 「れ、レナさぁぁんっっ！！」
TextENG: ``R-Rena-saaan!!``
``...Ahahahaha!@k@vS14/02/210200080. No good, no good!!``

TextJPN: 「ここから先は一歩も通さないッッ！！」
TextENG: ``You won't take another step closer!!``

TextJPN: すぱぱぱぱ――――んっっっ！！！
TextENG: *pow* *pow* *pow*

TextJPN: レナの神速にも近い攻撃を受けて、再び倒されてしまう別働隊。しかも今度は、仰向けではなくうつぶせに倒れるようひねりを加えた複合技ッ？！
TextENG: The detached corps was once again defeated by Rena's godlike speed. What's more, this time she used a combination technique with a twist to get them to fall face-down rather than on their backs?!
``Nice work, Rena-san!!@k@vS14/04/210400134. ...The numbers are 577, 269, 174!!``

TextJPN: うつぶせに倒れた彼らは、沙都子からは逆立ちの格好になる。そしてその結果、逆さまだった背番号は元の向きに戻されて読みやすくなってしまった…！
TextENG: From Satoko's perspective, the kids who fell over were practically doing a handstand. As a result, the inverted numbers were returned to their original orientation, making them far easier to read...!

TextJPN: 「あはははは！@k@vS14/02/210200083.　さすが圭一くん、面白い作戦だよ！！@k@vS14/02/210200084.　ほんのちょっとだけ焦っちゃったかな？　かな？」
TextENG: ``Ahahahaha!@k@vS14/02/210200083. Well done, Keiichi-kun. That's an interesting strategy!!@k@vS14/02/210200084. I wonder if he's feeling a little bit flustered? Flustered?``

TextJPN: 「をーっほっほっほっ！！@k@vS14/04/210400136.　所詮は付け焼刃の浅知恵でございますわっ！！」
TextENG: ``Oh ho ho ho!!@k@vS14/04/210400136. In the end, it was but a hasty attempt to retemper a dull blade!!``

TextJPN: 別働隊を殲滅したレナと沙都子は、すぐさま俺たち本隊の前に立ち塞がった。そして隙あらば背後を奪おうと、右に左に回り込もうとする。もちろん、ハンター役である魅音の視界を計算しての上だ。
TextENG: After eliminating the detached corps, Rena and Satoko immediately moved in front of the main squad. Then they tried to wrap around to the left and right to steal a glance at our backs. Of course, that was keeping in mind Mion's field of view as the hunter.

TextJPN: いわば長距離からの艦砲射撃を回避しながらの、２機の戦闘機相手のドッグファイト。さすがは、部活メンバーだ。…しかし！　そんなことは先刻承知の上っ！！
TextENG: In other words, we needed to engage in a dogfight against two enemy fighters while avoiding their long-range sniper fire.
``...Rena!@k@vS14/01/210100186. You're my opponent!!``

TextJPN: 「あはははは！@k@vS14/02/210200086.　残念だけど今のレナには、圭一くんだって相手じゃないよ。@k@vS14/02/210200087.一歩でも間合いに入ったら、圭一くんだって容赦しないからね！！」
TextENG: ``Ahahahaha!@k@vS14/02/210200086. Sorry Keiichi-kun, but you're not my opponent at the moment.@k@vS14/02/210200087. I won't allow even you to take even one step closer!!``

TextJPN: 「おぉよ、上等ッ！@k@vS14/01/210100188.　――大樹！　傑！　沙都子は頼んだ！！」
TextENG: ``Ohh, it is on!@k@vS14/01/210100188. ...Daiki! Suguru! I'll leave Satoko to you!!``

TextJPN: 「了解です！」
TextENG: ``Roger!``

TextJPN: 「任せてください！」
TextENG: ``Leave it to us!``

TextJPN: 二人はそう言うと、俺から沙都子を引き離すべくじりじりと横歩きで牽制する。…さすがに、野球部で鍛えてるだけあって並行移動はうまいものだ。
TextENG: They dodged sideways as they said that to lure Satoko away from me. ...They were able to skillfully switch directions, as expected of members of the baseball club.

TextJPN: 一瞬の隙を突いて、沙都子は二人の背後に回ろうとする。が、すぐに二人は背中合わせになってお互いの背番号を隠しあった。
TextENG: Satoko quickly took that chance to move behind them. However, they quickly stood back to back to conceal one another's numbers.
``S-such cowardice!@k@vS14/04/210400139. Rikaa?!``

TextJPN: 「――隠し方は特に決めてませんです。@k@vS14/05/210500121.ノージャッジなのです」
TextENG: ``...There were no stated rules about hiding them.@k@vS14/05/210500121. No violation.``

TextJPN: 梨花ちゃんの却下を受けて、仕方なく沙都子は二人を捕まえようと飛び掛る。が、ここは悲しいかな体格差、思うようにいかず缶のある場所への肉薄を徐々に許しつつあった。
TextENG: After Rika-chan's rejection, Satoko had no choice but to jump out and chase them. However, thanks to the demanding nature of that, it would leave the area near the can more exposed.

TextJPN: 「レナさぁんっ！　二人を足止めして！！」
TextENG: ``Rena-saaan! Stop those two!!``

TextJPN: 「おっと！@k@vS14/01/210100190.　お前の相手は俺じゃないのか？」
TextENG: ``Tsk tsk!@k@vS14/01/210100190. Didn't I tell you I'm your opponent?``

TextJPN: 今にも缶のある場所へとダッシュする、と俺が牽制をかけるのを見て、レナはその場に踏みとどまる。
TextENG: Rena stopped for a moment and watched as I began to dash toward the can.

TextJPN: そして、ついに俺をターゲットと決めたか、さっきまでの笑みを消して無表情のまなざしで向き直った。
TextENG: Then, she finally settled on me as the target and turned toward me with an expressionless look, devoid of her earlier smile.

TextJPN: 「圭一くん……。@k@vS14/02/210200092.邪魔すると、レナもちょっとだけ、――怒るよ？」
TextENG: ``Keiichi-kun...@k@vS14/02/210200092. If you get in the way, it'll make Rena a little bit... angry, okay?``

TextJPN: 「そいつは面白いな。@k@vS14/01/210100192.怒ったレナも『ぷりちー』だから、目に焼き付けておきたいぜ！」
TextENG: ``How interesting.@k@vS14/01/210100192. Angry Rena is pretty too, so I want that image of you burned into my eyes!``
``So... you've made your choice then?@k@vS14/02/210200094. Then... shall we go?``

TextJPN: ゾクッ……！！
TextENG: *shudder*

TextJPN: レナの目が、鳶色に鋭くなる。猛烈なプレッシャーに足が、いや全身が凍りついたように固まり、微動だにできなくなった。
TextENG: Rena's eyes sharpened and turned deep red. It felt like there was intense pressure on my legs. No, my entire body was frozen. I couldn't move.

TextJPN: 射すくめるような、強い眼光。――そして、
TextENG: The light in her eyes was strong enough to pin an enemy down. ...And then,

TextJPN: ほとんど反射的にバックステップして、脇と胸に襲い掛かってきた腕を紙一重でかわす。ちらり、と体操服の襟元を見ると、上のボタンがひとつ、いつの間にかなくなっていた。
TextENG: I reflexively stepped back in the nick of time to dodge an arm that reached for my chest and side. When I looked down on the neckline of my gym shirt, I noticed one of the buttons was missing.

TextJPN: 「さすがだね。@k@vS14/02/210200096.もらったと思ったのに」
TextENG: ``Nicely done.@k@vS14/02/210200096. I thought I had you there.``

TextJPN: 「でも、次は――？」
TextENG: ``But, what now...?``

TextJPN: じりっ、とレナが足を進めて間合いを詰め、押し潰されそうな気迫に圧倒されて足を引きそうになるが…すんでで、何とかこらえる。そして、
TextENG: Rena advanced forward to close the gap. I was still so overwhelmed by the pressure that I was about to be crushed, but... somehow, I managed to endure it. And then,

TextJPN: 俺はレナを見ているうち、眼光の鋭さに惑わされていたことを悟る。
TextENG: As I watched Rena, I realized it was the sharpness of her gaze that threw me off.

TextJPN: そしてレナの全身に視界を広げると、その動きと気配、そして今自分と同じようにレナも、荒い息をついて肩を上下させていることが見えた。
TextENG: Then, I widened my field of view around Rena so I could see her movements and signs, and once I did I could see that Rena was breathing heavily and drooping her shoulders, just like me.

TextJPN: ――そうか、目か…！　目を見なければ、それなりに相手の動きが見える…！！
TextENG: ...That's it, her eyes! As long as our eyes don't meet, I can still clearly see her movements...!!

TextJPN: もちろん、こちらの心理の不安定が伝わらないように…視線の焦点は茫洋と広げたまま、俺は悠然とした態を保って構えをとる。
TextENG: Of course, I couldn't let her pick up on my mental instability... so I maintained my wider field of focus and assumed a resolute posture.

TextJPN: 不安を感じているのは、レナも俺と同じだ。特に実力が拮抗すればするほど、動きがすなわち隙につながる、と警戒して攻撃に躊躇を覚えるもの。
TextENG: Rena must be feeling just as anxious as me. The more balanced the powers of us are, the more crucial opportunity one's movements give to the other. So we have to be vigilant of opportunities of attack.

TextJPN: だから本来、こういう場合は相手の動きを見て反撃するのが最も有利な戦法で、先に動いた方が逆に劣勢となる。
TextENG: So in that case, the most optimal strategy is to carefully study your opponent and be prepared to launch a counterattack. Whoever moves first will be at a disadvantage.

TextJPN: しかし…俺と違ってレナは、大樹と傑と戦っている沙都子の加勢に行かねば、と焦りを感じているはずだ。
TextENG: However... unlike me, Rena must feel pressed for time since she also needs to go help Satoko deal with Daiki and Suguru.

TextJPN: その焦りと、躊躇のせめぎあいが強引な突破を選ばせて、すなわち俺にとっては最大のチャンスとなる…！！
TextENG: And that impatience will force her to launch a brute force attack. Which is, of course, a perfect opportunity for me...!!

TextJPN: そう思った次の瞬間、レナの俺の左袖をつかもうとする動きを感じて、俺は小さく右にバックステップしてそれをかわす。
TextENG: A moment later, I felt Rena moving in to grab my left sleeve, so I stepped back and to the right to dodge.

TextJPN: そして、続いてすれ違いざま左足にかけてきたレナの足の引っかけをくるりと回し、その勢いで軽くとん、とレナの肩を小突いた。
TextENG: Then, I hooked my leg around Rena's left leg which had just stepped past me, and lightly pushed on Rena's shoulder to take advantage of her momentum.

TextJPN: 「きゃあっ？！」
TextENG: ``Kyah?!``

TextJPN: その攻撃が予想外だったのか、レナは見事に転んで尻餅をつく。慌てて助け起こそうとしたが、今の自分の状況をすんでで思い出して足を止めた。
TextENG: Apparently unable to predict that attack, Rena stumbled down and landed on her butt. I quickly rushed in to help her before remembering our current situation and came to a stop.

TextJPN: 「はぅ～～、圭一くん、ひどい…！」
TextENG: ``Hau~~. Keiichi-kun, you're awful...!``

TextJPN: 「ご、ごめん！@k@vS14/01/210100197.　ま、まさか転ぶとは思わなかった…！」
TextENG: ``S-sorry!@k@vS14/01/210100197. I-I didn't think you'd fall like that...!``

TextJPN: 「あ～あ、圭ちゃんひどいね～？@k@vS14/03/210300199.　こりゃ罰ゲームは相当覚悟してもらわないとね」
TextENG: ``Aah~, that was awful, Kei-chan~.@k@vS14/03/210300199. You'd better be prepared for one heck of a punishment for this.``

TextJPN: 俺は、缶を守っていたはずの魅音がここにいる意味を思い出して、ぎょっと向き直る。果たして魅音の肩越しに見える向こうには、失意に膝を屈した大樹と、傑の姿が…！
TextENG: Mion was supposed to be protecting the can, so when I understood the implication of her being over here I quickly turned around. Beyond Mion's shoulders, I could see Daiki and Suguru suddenly kneeling on the ground...!

TextJPN: 「さて…なかなか楽しませてもらったけどね。@k@vS14/03/210300201.そろそろゲーム終了と行きましょうか！」
TextENG: ``Well... that was pretty fun.@k@vS14/03/210300201. But it's about time to end this game!``

TextJPN: 「をっほっほっ！@k@vS14/04/210400142.　さすが圭一さんですが…いかんせん駒不足でしたわねぇ！」
TextENG: ``Oh ho ho!@k@vS14/04/210400142. Well done, Keiichi-san... but your pawns were not enough!``

TextJPN: 沙都子も不敵な笑みで、俺を取り囲もうと迫ってきている。気がつけばレナも立ち上がって、俺の退路を絶とうと背後に回りこむべく、じりじりと間合いを詰めてきた。
TextENG: Satoko was also heading toward me with a fearless smile on her face. Then I noticed that Rena had gotten up and was moving behind me, trying to cut off my retreat.

TextJPN: このままいけば、ひとりに背番号を見られた後は二人がかりで捕まり、その間に缶のところまで戻られてゲームオーバーだ…！
TextENG: If things keep up like this, one of them will be able to see my number and the other will get me out. If they can make it back to the can, it'll be game over...!

TextJPN: 「い、いいのかよ魅音、陣地を無人にして…？@k@vS14/01/210100201.　まだ兵隊は、残っているはずだぜ？」
TextENG: ``M-Mion, is it really all right to leave your base unattended...?@k@vS14/01/210100201. There are still troops out there, you know?``

TextJPN: 「あっはっはっは！@k@vS14/03/210300203.　おじさんを甘く見ないでよ？@k@vS14/03/210300204.　残りの女の子たちは、もう走る元気もないってさっきまでの戦いと、キックオフのときに見て確認済みさ」
TextENG: ``Aahahaha!@k@vS14/03/210300203. Don't underestimate this ol' man.@k@vS14/03/210300204. I could tell at the time of kickoff that none of the girls had the energy to run anymore.``

TextJPN: なるほど…さすがは魅音、というところか…？
TextENG: I see... so Mion was able to foresee that much...?

TextJPN: 「いやー、それにしてもさっきのクイズは参ったね。@k@vS14/03/210300206.しばらく意味がわかんなくて、ずいぶん時間をロスしちゃったよ。@k@vS14/03/210300207.…まさか最初の１分、一つが二つに分かれるところだけが省略されて正解は５９分、なんてさ～！」
TextENG: ``Actually, you got the better of us with that quiz.@k@vS14/03/210300206. It took a while to figure it out, so we lost a lot of time. @k@vS14/03/210300207. ...Indeed, it only saves you the first minute, where one divides into two, so the answer is 59 minutes~!``

TextJPN: 「…ちなみに聞いておこう。@k@vS14/01/210100203.誰がわかった？」
TextENG: ``...By the way, let me ask.@k@vS14/01/210100203. Who figured it out?``

TextJPN: 「あははは、レナだよ。@k@vS14/02/210200101.でも魅ぃちゃんは最初に説明しても、しばらく理解できなかったみたいだけどね」
TextENG: ``Ahahaha, it was Rena.@k@vS14/02/210200101. Even though Mii-chan is able to explain it now, it took her a long time to really understand it.``

TextJPN: …なるほど、さすがは魅音だ…。
TextENG: ...I see. That's Mion all right...

TextJPN: 「さて…それじゃ覚悟はいいかな？@k@vS14/03/210300209.　ついでに罰ゲームも」
TextENG: ``Now then... have you prepared yourself?@k@vS14/03/210300209. This is a punishment game, by the way.``
``Sure.@k@vS14/01/210100205. ...But, are you okay with that?``

TextJPN: 「あそこにいる、缶に向かってる下級生たちは」
TextENG: ``The younger students are heading toward the can right over there.``

TextJPN: 「またまたご冗談を～！@k@vS14/03/210300212.　さっき言ったでしょ？@k@vS14/03/210300213.　もう走る元気は、あの子たちにないって！」
TextENG: ``Not that prank again~!@k@vS14/03/210300212. Didn't you try that earlier?@k@vS14/03/210300213. They don't have the energy to run!``

TextJPN: 「『歩く』元気は……あるみたいだけどな？」
TextENG: ``Sure... but it looks like they might have the energy to walk?``

TextJPN: それを聞いて、振り返った魅音は視線の先に見える、下級生の女の子たちの姿にぎょっ、と驚く。
TextENG: As soon as she heard that, Mion turned back and was shocked to see the younger girls.

TextJPN: ――そう！　これが最後の隠し玉！！
TextENG: ...Yes! Our last hidden ball play!!

TextJPN: 俺たち本隊が３人をひきつけている間に、女の子たちは体力を回復してついでに『ある仕掛け』をほどこし、遊撃隊として本陣に襲い掛かる！！
